Becoming_aware.description: Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer adding some Phenomenon to their model of the world. They are similar to Coming-to-believe words, except the latter generally involve reasoning from Evidence.

Instrument.arg_desc: The Cognizer uses an Instrument to (enable themselves to) become aware of the Phenomenon.  In some cases, the Instrument may appear in subject position.

Evidence.arg_desc: The Evidence is some fact that allows the Cognizer to become aware of something. It is normally expressed with PP-from:

Cognizer.arg_desc: The Cognizer is the person who becomes aware of a Phenomenon. It is normally expressed as an External Argument.

Topic.arg_desc: Topic indicates the general field within which the Phenomenon is found.

Phenomenon.arg_desc: Thm Phenomenon is the entity or situation in the world of which a Cognizer becomes aware. It is normally expressed as an Object:

Means.arg_desc: This FE identifes the Means by which the Cognizer becomes aware of the Phenomenon.

Know.description: Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer adding some Phenomenon to their model of the world. They are similar to Coming-to-believe words, except the latter generally involve reasoning from Evidence.

Warning.description: A Speaker warns an Addressee by giving a Message that describes an undesirable situation that may affect the Addressee. The warning may alternatively be described as about Topic pertaining to the undesirable situation, or issued via a specific Medium.

Addressee.arg_desc: The Addressee receives the warning from the Speaker.

Means.arg_desc: The Means describes the way the Speaker accomplishes the task of warning the Addressee.

Message.arg_desc: The Message is the communication produced by the Speaker.

Medium.arg_desc: This frame element is the Medium in which the Message is expressed.

Topic.arg_desc: The Topic is a general description of the content of the Message.

Speaker.arg_desc: The Speaker produces the Message to alert the Addressee as to possible danger.

Warning.description: A Speaker warns an Addressee by giving a Message that describes an undesirable situation that may affect the Addressee. The warning may alternatively be described as about Topic pertaining to the undesirable situation, or issued via a specific Medium.

Catastrophe.description: The words in this frame involve an Undesirable_event which affects the Patient negatively.  No agent need be involved.  The first calamity was a disastrous trade war with Holland.  It is sad to have to make a living by grubbing around in the dirt of a national calamity.  The result has been catastrophic.

Cause.arg_desc: The cause of the Undesirable_Event.

Patient.arg_desc: The entity that experiences the Undesirable_Event.  An environmental disaster is just what we need. Should hair loss befall you...

Catastrophe.description: The words in this frame involve an Undesirable_event which affects the Patient negatively.  No agent need be involved.  The first calamity was a disastrous trade war with Holland.  It is sad to have to make a living by grubbing around in the dirt of a national calamity.  The result has been catastrophic.

Placing_scenario.description: This frame represents the abstract scene in which an Agent manipulates a Theme's location, thus affecting a Goal which ends up co-located with the Theme.

Placing.description: Generally without overall (translational) motion,  an Agent places a Theme at a location, the Goal, which is profiled.  In this frame, the Theme is under the control of the Agent/Cause at the time of its arrival at the Goal.

Being_located.description: A Theme is in a stable position with respect to a Location.

Source.arg_desc: The Source is the location where the Theme begins its motion. Josef filled his flask from the whiskey bottle.

Means.arg_desc: The Means by which the filling occurs.

Cause.arg_desc: An event which brings about the filling of the Goal.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent is the actor who instigates the filling.

Theme.arg_desc: The Theme is the physical object or substance which changes location. Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls with butter.

Instrument.arg_desc: The Instrument with which the filling occurs.

Path.arg_desc: The Path is the trajectory of the motion.  Jess filled the container through a small hole in the lid.

Location.arg_desc: A salient entity that the Theme is located with respect to.

Placing.description: Generally without overall (translational) motion,  an Agent places a Theme at a location, the Goal, which is profiled.  In this frame, the Theme is under the control of the Agent/Cause at the time of its arrival at the Goal.

Cause_to_start.description: A Cause, animate or inanimate, causes a process, the Effect, to begin.

Causation.description: A Cause causes an Effect.  Alternatively, an Actor, a participant of a (implicit) Cause, may stand in for the Cause.  The entity Affected by the Causation may stand in for the overall Effect situation or event.

Means.arg_desc: The Means is the way in which the Cause causes the process to begin.

Cause.arg_desc: An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes.   The programme sparked a public outcry.

Effect.arg_desc: This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the process that the Cause initiates.

Affected.arg_desc: Agents in a joint or reciprocal action (e.g. exchange)

Actor.arg_desc: An entity which participates in a Cause, perhaps volitionally and perhaps not.

Causation.description: A Cause causes an Effect.  Alternatively, an Actor, a participant of a (implicit) Cause, may stand in for the Cause.  The entity Affected by the Causation may stand in for the overall Effect situation or event.

Drop_in_on.description: A Visitor arrives at the Host_location as a guest of the Host, for the purpose of achieving a Purpose. The Purpose is often social in nature, i.e., the visit itself constitutes a goal.

Visitor_arrival.description: An Agent arrives at a Goal that should enable their Purpose.

Access_scenario.description: A Theme is or is not capable of entering or accessing a Useful_location because of/despite a Barrier.

Visit_host_arrival.description: The Visitor arrives at the Host_location to visit the Host.

Arriving.description: An object Theme moves in the direction of a Goal. The Goal may be expressed or it may be understood from context, but its is always implied by the verb itself.

Visiting_scenario_arrival.description: An Agent arrives at a location that should help them achieve their Purpose. This situation is point-of-view-neutral.

Place.arg_desc: The larger area within which the visiting takes place.

Purpose.arg_desc: This FE identifies the purpose for which the Visitor arrives at a location associated with the Host.

Path.arg_desc: Path is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Normal_location nor the Host or Host_location.  In this frame, Path expressions almost always have a via-sense.

Visitor.arg_desc: The Visitor arrives at the Host_location to visit the Host for a Purpose.

Means.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Means by which an Visitor arrives.

Host.arg_desc: The Host is the person highly associated with the goal location of the Visitor, and who allows the Visitor onto his/her territory, and possibly to make use of available resources. The Host and Visitor and in a host-guest relationship.

Goal.arg_desc: Goal is any expression that tells where the Agent ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion.  Although always conceptually present and specific, Goal may sometimes be understood from context, rather than expressed by any separate constituent. Our visitors arrived yesterday.

Barrier.arg_desc: An entity that (at least potentially) prevents the Theme from getting to the Useful_location.

Theme.arg_desc: The Theme whose motion is blocked or free.

Source.arg_desc: Source is any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion. While Source expressions are possible in this frame, they are relatively infrequent.  If present, they often express a general direction from which a Theme moves, rather than a landmark away from which it moves.The cat approached the bird from behind.She arrived from New York yesterday.

Arriving.description: An object Theme moves in the direction of a Goal. The Goal may be expressed or it may be understood from context, but its is always implied by the verb itself.

Commerce_money-transfer.description: The subframe of the Commercial_transaction frame which involves the transfer of Money from the Buyer to the Seller (in exchange for the Goods).

Commerce_goods-transfer.description: The subframe of the Commercial_transaction in which the Seller gives the Goods to the Buyer (in exchange for the Money).

Money.arg_desc: Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction.

Rate.arg_desc: In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods.

Exchangers.arg_desc: The individuals participating in the commercial exchange, otherwise encoded as Buyer and Seller.

Goods.arg_desc: The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction.

Buyer.arg_desc: The Buyer wants the Goods and offers Money to a Seller in exchange for them.

Seller.arg_desc: The Seller has possession of the Goods and exchanges them for Money from a Buyer.

Commerce_money-transfer.description: The subframe of the Commercial_transaction frame which involves the transfer of Money from the Buyer to the Seller (in exchange for the Goods).

Sending.description: A Sender plans the Path (along with Source and Goal) of a Theme and places it in circumstances such that it travels along this Path under the power of some entity other than the Sender.  This frame also has a Recipient distinct from the Goal, as both can be present:

Delivery.description: A Deliverer hands off a Theme to a Recipient or (more indirectly) a Goal location, which is accessible to the Recipient.

Product_delivery.description: In order to facilitate the purchase of Goods which start off in a location distant from a Purchaser, a Deliverer transports and hands off the Goods to a Purchaser or (more indirectly) a Goal location which is accessible to the Purchaser.

Transfer.description: This frame involves a Donor transferring a Theme to a Recipient.

Post_transfer.description: The stage after the Theme is in the possession of the Recipient.

Theme.arg_desc: The objects being sent.

Source.arg_desc: The beginning of the path, similar to source except that it serves to define the path.

Recipient.arg_desc: This is the recipient of the sent Theme.

Sender.arg_desc: This is the person who initiates the movement of the Theme and, unlike Carrying, does not accompany it.

Goal.arg_desc: The end of the path and intended goal of the sending.

Means.arg_desc: The Means are intermediate actions performed by the Deliverer in order to move the package to the Goal.

Vehicle.arg_desc: The vehicle employed by the Deliverer.

Transferors.arg_desc: The Donor and Recipient conceived of as a unit.

Sending.description: A Sender plans the Path (along with Source and Goal) of a Theme and places it in circumstances such that it travels along this Path under the power of some entity other than the Sender.  This frame also has a Recipient distinct from the Goal, as both can be present:

Reasoning.description: An Arguer presents a Content, along with Support, to an Addressee.  The Content may refer elliptically to a course of action or it may refer to a proposition that the Addressee is to believe.  Some lexical units (e.g. "prove") indicate the speaker's belief about the Content.Jan argued that the evidence was inadmissable.Jan argued against the admissability of the evidence.Jan proved  that the evidence was inadmissable.

Result.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Result of an arguing event.

Support.arg_desc: Support lends epistemic support to a claim, or provides a reason for a course of action.Jan argued that gun was inadmissable as evidence because the police didn't have a search warrant.

Means.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Means by which an Arguer presents Content to an Addressee.Jan argued the evidence was admissable by waving the warrant in the air.

Content.arg_desc: The Arguer wants the Addressee to entertain the Content, which can be a proposition to be believed or a course of action to be taken, based on the Support presented.Jan argued that the evidence was inadmissable.

Arguer.arg_desc: The Arguer presents the Content before the Addressee.Jan argued that the evidence was inadmissable.

Addressee.arg_desc: Addressee is the entity before whom the Arguer presents a Content. Jan argued to the court that the evidence was inadmissable.

Protest.description: An Arguer presents a Content, along with Support, to an Addressee.  The Content may refer elliptically to a course of action or it may refer to a proposition that the Addressee is to believe.  Some lexical units (e.g. "prove") indicate the speaker's belief about the Content.Jan argued that the evidence was inadmissable.Jan argued against the admissability of the evidence.Jan proved  that the evidence was inadmissable.

Avoiding.description: An Agent avoids an Undesirable_situation under certain Circumstances. That situation may be an activity (e.g. going to school), or an entity (perhaps) metonymic for such an activity or situation (e.g. the curb).  In this frame, the situation is undesirable from the Agent's point of view (e.g. evade), and contrasts with scenes in which the situation is specifically undesirable to someone else (e.g. forbear) or from the point of view of an external morality (e.g. abstain).

Preventing_or_letting.description: A Potential_hindrance or an Agent (via their actions) keeps an Event from taking place, or despite the possibility of prevent the Event, do not do so. Lexical units which indicate that the event is not prevented, e.g. allow.v, are marked with the semantic type "Negative".  Some lexical units, like avert and avoid indicate that the Potential_hindrance or Agent would have been affected if the Event occurred.

Means.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Means by which avoiding occurs.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent avoids an Undesirable_situation.

Event.arg_desc: The Event is prevented from occurring by the Preventing_cause or the Agent.

Potential_hindrance.arg_desc: The Potential_hindrance is the force which keeps the Event from happening, or does not.

Preventing_or_letting.description: A Potential_hindrance or an Agent (via their actions) keeps an Event from taking place, or despite the possibility of prevent the Event, do not do so. Lexical units which indicate that the event is not prevented, e.g. allow.v, are marked with the semantic type "Negative".  Some lexical units, like avert and avoid indicate that the Potential_hindrance or Agent would have been affected if the Event occurred.

Motion_scenario.description: This frame binds together the various parts of movement, from setting out, to traveling, to arriving.

Cause_motion.description: An Agent causes a Theme to move from a Source, along a Path, to a Goal.  Different members of the frame emphasize the trajectory to different degrees, and a given instance of the frame will usually leave some of the Source, Path and/or Goal implicit. The completion of motion is not required (unlike the Placing frame, see below), although individual sentences annotated with this frame may emphasize the Goal.

Cause_to_move_in_place.description: An Agent causes a Theme to move with respect to a certain Fixed_location, generally with a certain Periodicity, without undergoing unbounded translational motion or significant alteration of configuration/shape.

Motion.description: Some entity (Theme) starts out in one place (Source) and ends up in some other place (Goal), having covered some space between the two (Path). Alternatively, the Area or Directionin which the Theme moves or the Distance of the movement may be mentioned.

Cause_fluidic_motion.description: An Agent or a Cause causes a Fluid to move from a Source to a Goal along a Path or within an Area.

Fluidic_motion.description: In this frame a Fluid moves from a Source to a Goal along a Path or within an Area.   The blood spurted from the wound. The water gushed into the house .

Mass_motion.description: A Mass_theme, generally made up of many individuals, moves from a Source to a Goal with some Path.

Speed.arg_desc: The Speed is the rate at which motion occurs.

Path.arg_desc: The Path refers to (a part of the) ground that the Theme travels over or to a landmark the Theme travels past.

Goal.arg_desc: The Goal is the location the Theme ends up in.

Theme.arg_desc: The Theme is the entity that changes location.

Time.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Time when the motion occurs.

Area.arg_desc: The Area is the setting in which the Theme's movement takes place.

Distance.arg_desc: The Distance is any expression which characterizes the extent of motion.

Source.arg_desc: The Source is the location the Theme initially occupies before its change of location.

Means.arg_desc: The FE Means indicates the action that is taken that results in the motion of the Theme

Cause.arg_desc: Cause marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that causes the Theme to be set in motion.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent is the one whose action causes the motion of a Theme.  The Agent is generally realized as the External Argument.

Fixed_location.arg_desc: The point or set of points that define the limits of motion for the Theme.  For spinning motions, it is the axis, for vibrating it is a boundary, for swinging it is a point.

Motion.description: Some entity (Theme) starts out in one place (Source) and ends up in some other place (Goal), having covered some space between the two (Path). Alternatively, the Area or Directionin which the Theme moves or the Distance of the movement may be mentioned.

Temporary_leave.description: A Person takes leave from his or her routine Activity (such as work or school) for a Duration of time.  The Duration can be any length of time, as long as the absence is temporary.

Duration.arg_desc: The amount of time the Person is absent from his or her Activity.  This can also be expressed as a description of a duration, as shown below:

Purpose.arg_desc: The Person's intended purpose for the temporary leave.

Person.arg_desc: The person who is absent from his or her Activity for a Duration of time.

Activity.arg_desc: This FE describes the activity or responsiblilities from which the Person is taking a temporary leave.

Temporary_leave.description: A Person takes leave from his or her routine Activity (such as work or school) for a Duration of time.  The Duration can be any length of time, as long as the absence is temporary.

Damaging.description: An Agent affects a Patient in such a way that the Patient (or some Subregion of the Patient) ends up in a non-canonical state.  Often this non-canonical state is undesirable, and some lexical units (marked with the Negative semantic type) specifically indicate that the Patient is negatively affected.  Some lexical units of this frame indicate by what means the Patient is altered (e.g., scrape.v) and in some cases give some indication of the detailed effect on the Patient (e.g., score.v, chip.v), and in other cases, both are specified (tear.v). For another set of lexical units, the action and its result are much less specified (e.g., damage.v).

Patient.arg_desc: The entity which is affected by the Agent so that it is damaged.

Instrument.arg_desc: An entity directed by the Agent that interacts with a Patient to accomplish the damage.

Subregion.arg_desc: The part of the Patient which is directly affected by the damaging.

Means.arg_desc: An intentional action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the damage.

Cause.arg_desc: An event which leads to the damage of the Patient.

Agent.arg_desc: The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the damage to the Patient.

Damaging.description: An Agent affects a Patient in such a way that the Patient (or some Subregion of the Patient) ends up in a non-canonical state.  Often this non-canonical state is undesirable, and some lexical units (marked with the Negative semantic type) specifically indicate that the Patient is negatively affected.  Some lexical units of this frame indicate by what means the Patient is altered (e.g., scrape.v) and in some cases give some indication of the detailed effect on the Patient (e.g., score.v, chip.v), and in other cases, both are specified (tear.v). For another set of lexical units, the action and its result are much less specified (e.g., damage.v).

Destroying.description: A Destroyer (a conscious entity) or Cause (an event, or an entity involved in such an event) affects the Patient negatively so that the Patient no longer exists.  An asteroid obliterated the dinosaurs.

Cause_to_fragment.description: An Agent suddenly and often violently separates the Whole_patient into two or more smaller Pieces, resulting in the Whole_patient no longer existing as such.  Several lexical items are marked with the semantic type Negative, which indicates that the fragmentation is necessarily judged as injurious to the original Whole_patient.

Render_nonfunctional.description: An Agent affects an Artifact so that it is no longer capable of performing its inherent function.

Destroyer.arg_desc: The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the Patient's destruction.  Who can unmake the ring?

Means.arg_desc: An intentional action performed by the Destroyer that accomplishes the destruction.

Instrument.arg_desc: An entity directed by the Destroyer that interacts with a Patient to accomplish the Patient's destruction.

Cause.arg_desc: The event or entity which is responsible for the destruction of the Patient. The subsequent explosions leveled most downtown office buildings. Tornados vaporized this town a few decades back.

Patient.arg_desc: The entity which is destroyed by the Destroyer.  Who can unmake the ring?

Pieces.arg_desc: The fragments of the Whole_patient that result from the Agent's action.

Destroying.description: A Destroyer (a conscious entity) or Cause (an event, or an entity involved in such an event) affects the Patient negatively so that the Patient no longer exists.  An asteroid obliterated the dinosaurs.

Death.description: The words in this frame describe the death of a Protagonist.  A Cause of death may also be expressed obliquely.

Losing_someone.description: This frame describes a Sufferer who experiences the loss of someone through death.  The LUs in this frame imply a strong emotional connection between the Sufferer and the Deceased.

Sufferer.arg_desc: The being or entity that emotionally experiences the death of the Deceased.

Death.description: The words in this frame describe the death of a Protagonist.  A Cause of death may also be expressed obliquely.

Perception_active.description: This frame contains perception words whose perceivers intentionally direct their attention to some entity or phenomenon in order to have a perceptual experience.  For this reason we call the perceiver role in this frame Perceiver_agentive.

Phenomenon.arg_desc: Phenomenon indicates the entity or phenomenon to which the Perceiver_agentive directs his or her attention in order to have a perceptual experience. Typically, it is expressed as an Object with verbs.

Means.arg_desc: The Means indicates the tool or method the Perceiver_agentive is using to actively perceive the Phenomenon.  May be confused with Direction in cases with through-PP, but is referring more to the instrument used than the path used.

Direction.arg_desc: Direction is used for all path-like expressions that describe how the perceiver's attention is directed during the act of perception, with the exception of those indicating the location of the Perceiver_agentive (which would be marked Location_of_perceiver)

Perceiver_agentive.arg_desc: The Perceiver_agentive performs some action in order to have a perceptual experience. It is expressed as an External Argument:

Perception_active.description: This frame contains perception words whose perceivers intentionally direct their attention to some entity or phenomenon in order to have a perceptual experience.  For this reason we call the perceiver role in this frame Perceiver_agentive.

Circumscribed_existence.description: An Entity is understood to be experienceable within a particular set of delimited Circumstances, which may be more narrowly expressed by a Time, Place.

Presence.description: An Entity exists at a particular Location, at a particular Time, as observed by an implicit observer. A Depictive and/or Duration phrase is often found.

Existence.description: An Entity is declared to exist, generally irrespective of its position or even the possibility of its position being specified. Time, Duration, Inherent_purpose, and State may also be mentioned.

Time.arg_desc: The time when the Entity is present at the Location.

Place.arg_desc: A spacial characterization of the Circumstances of the existence of the Entity.

Circumstances.arg_desc: A description of the state of the world in which the Entity can be experienced.

Location.arg_desc: The Location of the Entity. The Location is conceived as a ground for an event of inspection to determine the presense of the Entity.

Duration.arg_desc: The time period during which the Entity is present. In this frame, Duration may be expressed with for preceding an event which stands for the duration of the event. In cases where the Entity is sentient, there may be an inference that the Entity's intent is to be present so as to participate in the event.

Entity.arg_desc: The Entity whose existence at the Location is confirmed.

Inherent_purpose.arg_desc: The reason why the Entity exists.  Generally, this is more specifically the reason why the Entity was made.

Presence.description: An Entity exists at a particular Location, at a particular Time, as observed by an implicit observer. A Depictive and/or Duration phrase is often found.

Subjective_influence.description: An Agent, Situation or Entity has an influence on a Cognizer. The influence may be general; or it may be manifested in the Cognizer's engaging in an Action as a consequence of the influence; or the Cognizer may be influenced in how they carry out a Behavior that they are engaged in already. Alternatively, a Product may be specified whose production or design was influenced by the Cognizer's experience of the  Situation or Entity.

Eventive_cognizer_affecting.description: An Event causes the Cognizer to accept some Content.  Although the Cognizer forms an intention, it is not entailed that he/she acts.

Action.arg_desc: An Action that the Cognizer decides to carry out as a consequence of the influence of a Situation or Entity.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent acts to influence a Cognizer.

Behavior.arg_desc: A Behavior that the Cognizer is engaged in independently but whose execution is subsequently influenced by the Situation or Entity.

Cognizer.arg_desc: The person who is influenced by the Situation or Entity.

Product.arg_desc: An entity that stands metonymically for the actions and considerations that produced it.

Situation.arg_desc: A state of affairs--- which can be an event, state or conditions---that has an influence on the Cognizer.

Influence.description: An Agent, Situation or Entity has an influence on a Cognizer. The influence may be general; or it may be manifested in the Cognizer's engaging in an Action as a consequence of the influence; or the Cognizer may be influenced in how they carry out a Behavior that they are engaged in already. Alternatively, a Product may be specified whose production or design was influenced by the Cognizer's experience of the  Situation or Entity.

Post_receiving.description: The state-of-affairs immediately after the Recipient has come into possession of the Theme offered by the Donor.

Receiving.description: A Recipient comes into possession of the Theme as a result of the joint action of the Donor and the Recipient.  The Receiving frame like the Giving frame requires that the Donor first has possession of the Theme and that following the transfer, the Donorno longer has the Theme and the Recipient does.

Donor.arg_desc: The person who gives the Theme to the Recipient.

Theme.arg_desc: The entity that changes possession, beginning in the possession of the Donor and ending up with the Recipient.

Recipient.arg_desc: The person who acts to come into possession of the Theme.

Receiving.description: A Recipient comes into possession of the Theme as a result of the joint action of the Donor and the Recipient.  The Receiving frame like the Giving frame requires that the Donor first has possession of the Theme and that following the transfer, the Donorno longer has the Theme and the Recipient does.

Verification.description: An Inspector attains a degree of certainty in the Unconfirmed_content, generally by inspecting some evidence.

Means.arg_desc: An action performed by the Inspector by which the Inspector manages to establish the truth of the Unconfirmed_content.

Inspector.arg_desc: The individual or individuals that ascertain that the Unconfirmed_content is true.

Unconfirmed_content.arg_desc: An open proposition that the Inspector decides by examining evidence.  It is usually a propostion put forward which some parties would disbelieve or contest.

Instrument.arg_desc: A tool or instrument used by the Inspector in the verification process.

Check.description: An Inspector attains a degree of certainty in the Unconfirmed_content, generally by inspecting some evidence.

Hostile_encounter.description: This frame consists of words that describe a hostile encounter between opposing forces (Side_1 and Side_2, collectively conceptualizable as Sides) over a disputed Issue and/or in order to reach a specific  Purpose.

Instrument.arg_desc: The Instrument with which an intentional act is performed.

Side_1.arg_desc: One of two participants in a hostile encounter.

Purpose.arg_desc: The desired result of the outcome of the hostile encounter for the Side_1 or for all the Sides collectively.  It may either directly refer to the state of affairs that is desired, e.g.

Side_2.arg_desc: One of two participants in a hostile encounter, usually the second mentioned.

Sides.arg_desc: The jointly expressed sides in a hostile encounter.

Issue.arg_desc: An unresolved question over which the two sides of a hostile encounter are in disagreement.

Hostile_encounter.description: This frame consists of words that describe a hostile encounter between opposing forces (Side_1 and Side_2, collectively conceptualizable as Sides) over a disputed Issue and/or in order to reach a specific  Purpose.

Killing.description: A Killer or Cause causes the death of the Victim.

Means.arg_desc: The method or action that the Killer or Cause performs resulting in the death of the Victim.

Killer.arg_desc: The person or sentient entity that causes the death of the Victim.

Cause.arg_desc: An inanimate entity or process that causes the death of the Victim.

Victim.arg_desc: The living entity that dies as a result of the killing.

Instrument.arg_desc: The device used by the Killer to bring about the death of the Victim.

Killing.description: A Killer or Cause causes the death of the Victim.

Conquering.description: This frame describes a Theme losing its autonomy and perhaps sustaining material damage as the result of a successful invasion on the behalf of a Conqueror.

Theme.arg_desc: The Theme is the land, government, and its people that is seized by the Conqueror.

Means.arg_desc: The action by which the conquering event is made possible through the efforts of the Conqueror.

Conqueror.arg_desc: The Conqueror is the entity that overtakes the Theme.

Conquering.description: This frame describes a Theme losing its autonomy and perhaps sustaining material damage as the result of a successful invasion on the behalf of a Conqueror.

Releasing_from_custody.description: The Authorities release a Suspect who has been held under suspicion of having committed a crime.

Bail_decision.description: This frame covers a step in a criminal process in which a  Judge decides whether the Accused should be released on bail, and, if so, what the amount of the bail should be.

Releasing.description: A Captor ends the captivity or inhibition of the motion of a Theme from the Location_of_confinement. The release is in accord with the plans of the Captor.

Freeing_from_confinement.description: An Agent causes a Theme which was held captive to be free from a Location_of_confinement, against the wishes of the captors.

Breaking_out_captive.description: An Agent brings about the end of a Theme's captivity at a Location_of_confinement in contravention of the plans or desires of a captor.

Authorities.arg_desc: The Authorities are those who have the official authority to release a Suspect.

Status.arg_desc: Status idenitifies the decision made with regard to bail.  The possible statuses are "without bail/bond", "on one's own recognizance", or a specific amount of money required for bail.

Location_of_confinement.arg_desc: The location to which the Theme's motion was formerly inhibited.

Theme.arg_desc: The Theme is the person or object in motion released by the Captor.

Releasing.description: A Captor ends the captivity or inhibition of the motion of a Theme from the Location_of_confinement. The release is in accord with the plans of the Captor.

Counterattack.description: An Assailant physically attacks a Victim (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the Victim physical damage. The attack is a response to an earlier attack by the Victim on the current Assailant (or by actors associated with the Assailant or Victim).

Attack.description: An Assailant physically attacks a Victim (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the Victim physical damage.   A Weapon used by the Assailant may also be mentioned, in addition to the usual Place, Time, Purpose, Explanation, etc.  Sometimes a location is used metonymically to stand for the Assailant or the Victim, and in such cases the Place FE will be annotated on a second FE layer.

Invading.description: The Invader enters a Land in an aggressive attempt to cripple or dominate its people and its government.

Suicide_attack.description: An Assailant attacks a Victim, intending to die in the process. In the prototypical case, the attack is designed to kill the Assailant, as when a pilot deliberately crashes a plane into the target.

Weapon.arg_desc: An entity used by the Assailant to cause damage to the Victim.

Assailant.arg_desc: The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the Victim.

Victim.arg_desc: This FE is the being or entity that is injured by the Assailant's attack.

Means.arg_desc: An intentional action performed by the Assailant that accomplishes the assault.

Attack.description: An Assailant physically attacks a Victim (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the Victim physical damage.   A Weapon used by the Assailant may also be mentioned, in addition to the usual Place, Time, Purpose, Explanation, etc.  Sometimes a location is used metonymically to stand for the Assailant or the Victim, and in such cases the Place FE will be annotated on a second FE layer.

Earnings_and_losses.description: An Earner receives Earnings by providing Goods to a Buyer; providing the Goods also generally entails a cost, which may or may not be included in the consideration.  This frame emphasizes the effect on the Earner and often generalizes across an indefinite number of transactions with various parties.  Some of the LUs (e.g. earn.v) primarily refer to the to the Earnings without reference to cost, others to the amount the Earnings differ from the cost, emphasizing either a net loss (e.g. loss.n) or net gain (e.g. net.n).

Buyer.arg_desc: The Buyer is the source of the Earnings of the Earner.

Earnings.arg_desc: Earnings are the money given to the Earner in a transaction, generally in exchange for Goods.

Goods.arg_desc: Goods is anything including labor or time, for example, which is exchanged for Earnings in a transaction.

Earner.arg_desc: The Earner is involved in a transaction or set of transactions as the party that receives payment.

Earnings_and_losses.description: An Earner receives Earnings by providing Goods to a Buyer; providing the Goods also generally entails a cost, which may or may not be included in the consideration.  This frame emphasizes the effect on the Earner and often generalizes across an indefinite number of transactions with various parties.  Some of the LUs (e.g. earn.v) primarily refer to the to the Earnings without reference to cost, others to the amount the Earnings differ from the cost, emphasizing either a net loss (e.g. loss.n) or net gain (e.g. net.n).

Adopt_selection.description: An Agent has an Attribute which can take different Values, and the Agent selects and then begins to use some Value for that Attribute.  The Attribute includes both physical (shape, color) and abstract (belief, practice) types.  For some LUs in this frame, it is common for only the Value to be expressed, with the Attribute implicit. (Often this implicit attribute can be given second-layer expression on the Value. Note that such second-layer annotation should be assumed in the first two examples below.)

Choosing.description: A Cognizer decides upon the Chosen (either an item or a course of action) out of a set of  Possibilities .  The Cognizer may have an Inherent_purpose or a Larger_purpose for the Chosen.

Attribute.arg_desc: The Attribute of the Agent can take on several Values, selected by the Agent .  The Council of Constance (1414-18) adopted conciliarism as a stance, hoping that it would permit the election of a pope acceptable to both Catholic factions.

Chosen.arg_desc: Chosen identifies the entity or course of action which is selected from among the Possibilities.

Possibilities.arg_desc: A Cognizer makes a choice from among a set of Possibilities. Possibilities are commonly expressed via an oblique phrase which indicates the alternative or alternatives, or by a subordinate clause (choosing to do it or choosing not to do it), typically headed by "whether or "if".

Cognizer.arg_desc: The Cognizer chooses the Chosen out of the Possibilities.

Choosing.description: A Cognizer decides upon the Chosen (either an item or a course of action) out of a set of  Possibilities .  The Cognizer may have an Inherent_purpose or a Larger_purpose for the Chosen.

Visiting.description: An Agent matches location with an Entity in order to fulfill some  Purpose.

Touring.description: A Tourist experiences an Attraction, a location with a unique history or other societally recognized individual character, with the goal of seeing and learning about it. Typically, the Attraction has a source of information about the Attraction--a guide, pamphlets, or displays.

Travel.description: In this frame a Traveler goes on a journey, an activity, generally planned in advance, in which the Traveler moves from a Source location to a Goal along a Path or within an Area.  The journey can be accompanied by Co-participants and Baggage.  The Duration or Distance of the journey, both generally long, may also be described as may be the Mode_of_transportation.  Words in this frame emphasize the whole process of getting from one place to another, rather than profiling merely the beginning or the end of the journey.

Entity.arg_desc: The physical entity that is permanently associated with entities or characteristics that the Agent wishes to use for some Purpose.  During the visit, the Agent matches location with the Entity.

Means.arg_desc: An action of the Agent that enables their visit.

Purpose.arg_desc: The activity that is enabled by the Entity and that the Agent wishes to achieve.

Goal.arg_desc: The Goal is the location where the travelers end up.

Speed.arg_desc: The Speed is the rate at which the travel takes place.

Distance.arg_desc: This FE dientifies the Distance traveled.

Path.arg_desc: The Path is the route along which the travel takes place.

Source.arg_desc: The Source is the starting point of the trip.

Area.arg_desc: This is the Area in which the traveling takes place. This frame element describes the enclosed area inside which travelling, of unspecified Source, Path or Goal takes place.

Traveler.arg_desc: This is the living being which travels. Normally, the Traveler is expressed as an external argument.

Traveling.description: An Agent matches location with an Entity in order to fulfill some  Purpose.

Rejuvenation.description: The action of an Agent or the occurrence of a Cause event returns an Entity to an earlier  state of vigor and strength.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent puts the Entity into a state of renewed vigor.

Entity.arg_desc: The concrete or abstract thing that is brought into an earlier state in which it was more effective and powerful.

Cause.arg_desc: An event or state whose occurrence brings about the Entity's return to a vigorous state.

Result.arg_desc: The end state of the Rejuvination action.

Instrument.arg_desc: The device used by the Agent to help accomplish the action indicated by the target.

Means.arg_desc: This FE identifies the action that the Agent performs in order so as to bring about the reinvigoration of the Entity.

Recovering.description: The action of an Agent or the occurrence of a Cause event returns an Entity to an earlier  state of vigor and strength.

Using.description: An Agent manipulates an Instrument in order to achieve a Purpose.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent uses the Instrument to achieve their Purpose.

Means.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Means by which an Agent uses the Instrument.

Instrument.arg_desc: An entity directed by the Agent that serves to bring about the Purpose of the Agent.

Purpose.arg_desc: This FE identifies the purpose for which an Agent uses the Instrument.

Using.description: An Agent manipulates an Instrument in order to achieve a Purpose.

Coming_to_be.description: An Entity comes into existence at a particular Place and Time which may take a certain Duration_of_endstate, have a Cause, or be formed from Components.

Components.arg_desc: This FE identifies the components out of which the Entity forms.

Entity.arg_desc: Concrete or abstract entity that did not exist before the Time of the event.

Place.arg_desc: This is the Place where the new Entity comes into being.

Time.arg_desc: This FE identifes the Time when a new Entity comes into existence.

Duration_of_final_state.arg_desc: This FE identifies the length of time that the Entity exists after coming to be.

Coming_to_be.description: An Entity comes into existence at a particular Place and Time which may take a certain Duration_of_endstate, have a Cause, or be formed from Components.

Cause_to_be_included.description: An Agent or Cause makes a New_member part of  Group. The Group may be represented by an individual Existing_member if it implies the existence of a set of members.

New_member.arg_desc: An item that becomes a part of the Group.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent is a volitional animate being who causes the New_member to become part of the Group.

Cause.arg_desc: An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that is responsible for causing a New_member to enter a Group.

Group.arg_desc: The Group is anything that can be conceptualized as a complex collection of parts or ingredients, including through metonymy like containers or locations, which New_members can join.  The companyincludes philanthropic endeavors in their accomplishments

Cause_to_be_included.description: An Agent or Cause makes a New_member part of  Group. The Group may be represented by an individual Existing_member if it implies the existence of a set of members.

Process_start.description: An Event begins at a certain Time and Place. Reason may also be indicated.  NB:  Refer to Event frame.

Activity_start.description: An Agent initiates the beginning of an ongoing Activity in which he will be continuously involved.

Initial_subevent.arg_desc: The Initial_subevent of the Event.The service began with a prayer.

Event.arg_desc: Name of the Event which occurs.

Agent.arg_desc: This FE identifies the being that starts the intentional Activity.

Process_start.description: An Event begins at a certain Time and Place. Reason may also be indicated.  NB:  Refer to Event frame.

Holding_off_on.description: An Agent decides temporarily not to perform a Desirable_action or not to interact with a Salient_entity.

Change_event_time.description: In this frame, an Agent or Cause changes the timing of an Event. The Event will then take place at the Destination_time or with respect to a Destination_event. This can be done with by certain Means, in a certain Manner or to a certain Degree.

Change_event_duration.description: In this frame, an Agent or Cause changes the duration of an Event. The Event will then take place for a New_duration, rather than the Initial_duration. This can be done with by certain Means, in a certain Manner or to a certain Degree.

Agent.arg_desc: The sentient entity that changes the duration of the Event.

End_point.arg_desc: The point in time, defined either as a clock time or in terms of an event that takes place, at which the Agent engages in the Desirable_action or interacts with the Salient_entity.

Salient_entity.arg_desc: An entity that evokes a contextually inferrable Desirable_action that the Agent is temporarily forgoing.

Landmark_time.arg_desc: The Landmark_time is when the Event was originally intended to take place.

Interval.arg_desc: The Interval between the Landmark_time and the Destination_time may be expressed.

Cause.arg_desc: The Cause is the non-sentient force which brings about the change of time for the Event.

Event.arg_desc: The Event is the occurrence which changes time. The opening of the musical was delayed.

New_duration.arg_desc: The new duration of the Event.

Initial_duration.arg_desc: The planned duration of the Event before the change takes place.

Change_event_time.description: In this frame, an Agent or Cause changes the timing of an Event. The Event will then take place at the Destination_time or with respect to a Destination_event. This can be done with by certain Means, in a certain Manner or to a certain Degree.

Reporting.description: In this frame an Informer informs the Authorities of the illegal or otherwise improper Behavior of the Wrongdoer.  Tony reported Michael to the police for breaking into his car.   The teacher reported the bathroom vandalism. DNI

Authorities.arg_desc: The Authorities are the officials, government or otherwise, who handle misbehavior.

Wrongdoer.arg_desc: The Wrongdoer has his or her activities reported to the Authorities.

Behavior.arg_desc: The Behavior is the action or actions for which the Wrongdoer is reported.

Informer.arg_desc: The Informer reports the activities of the Wrongdoer to the Authorities.

Reporting.description: In this frame an Informer informs the Authorities of the illegal or otherwise improper Behavior of the Wrongdoer.  Tony reported Michael to the police for breaking into his car.   The teacher reported the bathroom vandalism. DNI

Cause_harm.description: The words in this frame describe situations in which an Agent or a Cause injures a Victim. The Body_part of the Victim which is most directly affected may also be mentioned in the place of the Victim.  In such cases, the Victim is often indicated as a genitive modifier of the Body_part, in which case the Victim FE is indicated on a second FE layer.

Experience_bodily_harm.description: An Experiencer is involved in a bodily injury to a Body_part.  (In some cases, no Body_part need be indicated.)  Often an Injuring_entity on which the Experiencer injures themselves is mentioned.

Instrument.arg_desc: This FE is any object used to cause the injury.

Body_part.arg_desc: The Body_part identifies the location on the body where the bodily injury takes place.

Agent.arg_desc: Agent is the person causing the Victim's injury.

Victim.arg_desc: The Victim is the being or entity that is injured.  If the Victim is included in the phrase indicating Body_part, the Victim FE is tagged on a second FE layer (see 3rd example).

Cause.arg_desc: The Cause marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that inflicts harm on the Victim

Bodily_harm.description: The words in this frame describe situations in which an Agent or a Cause injures a Victim. The Body_part of the Victim which is most directly affected may also be mentioned in the place of the Victim.  In such cases, the Victim is often indicated as a genitive modifier of the Body_part, in which case the Victim FE is indicated on a second FE layer.

Suspicion.description: A person or group, the Authority, believes that another person, the Suspect is a participant in a criminal Incident.

Incident.arg_desc: The (typically criminal) Incident in which the Suspect is suspected of being involved.

Suspect.arg_desc: The Suspect is the target of the Authority's suspicion.

Authority.arg_desc: The Authority is the group or person who suspects the Suspect of criminal activity.

Suspicion.description: A person or group, the Authority, believes that another person, the Suspect is a participant in a criminal Incident.

Statement.description: This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a Speaker to address a Message to some Addressee using language. Instead of (or in addition to) a Speaker, a Medium may also be mentioned. Likewise, a Topic may be stated instead of a Message. A number of the words can be used performatively, such as declare and insist.

Medium.arg_desc: Medium is the physical entity or channel used by the Speaker to transmit the statement.

Speaker.arg_desc: The Speaker is the sentient entity that produces the Message (whether spoken or written).  It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the target

Addressee.arg_desc: The Addressee is the person to whom the Message is communicated. When this FE is expressed, it often appears in a prepositional phrase introduced by "to", or as a direct object.

Message.arg_desc: The Message is the FE that identifies the content of what the Speaker is communicating to the Addressee.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.

Statement.description: This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a Speaker to address a Message to some Addressee using language. Instead of (or in addition to) a Speaker, a Medium may also be mentioned. Likewise, a Topic may be stated instead of a Message. A number of the words can be used performatively, such as declare and insist.

Claim_ownership.description: A Claimant asserts his or her right to possession of a piece of Property (either real, such as land, or private).  The Claimant may be acting on the behalf of a Beneficiary.

Claimant.arg_desc: The Claimant asserts rights or priviliges, typically ownership, over some Property.

Property.arg_desc: The Property is declared to be under the ownership of the Claimant.

Beneficiary.arg_desc: The Beneficiary is declared the owner of the Property by the Claimant, or the person or group in whose name or favor the Claimant is acting.

Claim_ownership.description: A Claimant asserts his or her right to possession of a piece of Property (either real, such as land, or private).  The Claimant may be acting on the behalf of a Beneficiary.

Cause_change_of_position_on_a_scale.description: This frame consists of words that indicate that an Agent or a Cause affects the position of an Item on some scale (the Attribute) to change it from an initial value (Value_1) to an end value (Value_2). The direction of the change (Path) can be encoded as well as the magnitude of the change (Difference).

Path.arg_desc: Any expression that says something about the movement of the entity (Item) along the scale between its initial (Value-1) and its final position (Value-2).

Value_1.arg_desc: The initial value of the entity (Item) along the scale.

Item.arg_desc: The entity whose position along a scale is being changed.

Attribute.arg_desc: The scale along which the Item ranges in value.

Agent.arg_desc: The person who causes an entity (Item) to change its positon on a scale with respect to some property (Variable).

Difference.arg_desc: The distance between the orginial value (Value-1) and the final value (Value-2) of the entity on the scale (Variable).

Cause.arg_desc: The force that causes the change.

Value_2.arg_desc: The final position on the scale that the entity (Item) assumes.

Cause_change_of_position_on_a_scale.description: This frame consists of words that indicate that an Agent or a Cause affects the position of an Item on some scale (the Attribute) to change it from an initial value (Value_1) to an end value (Value_2). The direction of the change (Path) can be encoded as well as the magnitude of the change (Difference).

Coming_to_believe.description: A person (the Cognizer) comes to believe something (the Content), sometimes after a process of reasoning. This change in belief is usually initiated by a person or piece of Evidence. Occasionally words in this domain are accompanied by phrases expressing Topic, i.e. that which the mental Content is about.

Means.arg_desc: An act performed by the Cognizer which enables them to figure something out.

Content.arg_desc: With a target verb, the Content is usually expressed as a finite clausal Complement or an Object NP, and may sometimes be expressed by a PP:

Cognizer.arg_desc: Cognizer is the person who comes to believe something.

Coming_to_believe.description: A person (the Cognizer) comes to believe something (the Content), sometimes after a process of reasoning. This change in belief is usually initiated by a person or piece of Evidence. Occasionally words in this domain are accompanied by phrases expressing Topic, i.e. that which the mental Content is about.

Speak_on_topic.description: A Speaker addresses an Audience on a particular Topic.  The Audience is generally passive, although for many types of address (including academic talks and press conferences), a discussion or question-answer period is virtually always required.

Expressing_publicly.description: A Communicator publically communicates some difficult-to-express Content which they (or a social group of which they are a member) have had for some time. The Content may not have been previously communicated due to inability or social stricture.  In cases where the individuals addressed are a smaller group than the public at large, a separate Addressee may be expressed.

Addressee.arg_desc: The Addressee is the person to whom the Content is communicated.

Medium.arg_desc: Medium is the observable action or product of the Communicator.

Content.arg_desc: The attitude or feeling that the Communicator had not previously expressed.

Communicator.arg_desc: The Communicator is the person who expresses the Content (whether spoken or written).

Expressing_publicly.description: A Communicator publically communicates some difficult-to-express Content which they (or a social group of which they are a member) have had for some time. The Content may not have been previously communicated due to inability or social stricture.  In cases where the individuals addressed are a smaller group than the public at large, a separate Addressee may be expressed.

Request.description: In this frame a Speaker asks an Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.

Speaker.arg_desc: The Speaker, as in other communication frames, is generally an External Argument.

Medium.arg_desc: The Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. The Medium is frequently expressed as a PP Complement headed by on or in.

Message.arg_desc: The Message is the content of the request that can be expressed as a quote, in a finite or non-finite clausal Complement, an NP Object or PP Complement.

Addressee.arg_desc: In this frame the Addressee can either occur as an NP Object (usually with a following complement clause) or as a PP Complement of verbs or nouns.

Request.description: In this frame a Speaker asks an Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.

Being_in_control.description: A Controlling_entity has control of a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.

Domination.description: An Agent has a influential, controlling position in a Situation, and is the primary causal factor in the development of the Situation, leaving other Competitors unable to take controlling positions.

Control.description: A Controlling_entity, Controlling_situation, or Controlling_variable control a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable. The latter, dependent, element or some aspect of it is not just influenced, but determined by the controlling element.

Dependent_variable.arg_desc: A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of a Controlling_entity.

Competitor.arg_desc: The Competitors are trying to gain control of a situation, but end up being subject to the control and influence of the Agent .

Controlling_variable.arg_desc: A scalar variable (with unspecified value) which has an effect on the Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.

Control.description: A Controlling_entity, Controlling_situation, or Controlling_variable control a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable. The latter, dependent, element or some aspect of it is not just influenced, but determined by the controlling element.

Self_control.description: An Agent actively (yet not always with success) attempts to keep themselves from participating in an Event. The Agent is usually pushed to the Event because of an internal urge.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent who tries to keep an Event from taking place.

Event.arg_desc: The Event is the action or state of affairs that the Agent wishes to prevent.

Self_control.description: An Agent actively (yet not always with success) attempts to keep themselves from participating in an Event. The Agent is usually pushed to the Event because of an internal urge.

Supporting.description: A Supporter assists to strengthen the Supported by lending itself in material aid (or abstract assistance in the case of metaphorical uses).

Supported.arg_desc: The Supported is given strength through the assistance of the Supporter.

Supporter.arg_desc: The Supporter acts to benefit the Supported by providing additional strength or stability.

Instrument.arg_desc: An entity used by the Supporter in service of the Supported's strength by support.

Supporting.description: A Supporter assists to strengthen the Supported by lending itself in material aid (or abstract assistance in the case of metaphorical uses).

Repel.description: A Defender successfully repels the aggressive attempt of takeover by an Enemy.

Defending.description: A Defender responds to an Assailant's attack on a Victim by directly, and usually violently, countering it.

Invasion_act.arg_desc: This FE refers to the Invasion_act perpetrated by the Enemy.

Victim.arg_desc: The individual or entity that is under attack from the Assailant .

Assailant.arg_desc: The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the Victim.

Defender.arg_desc: This FE is the being or entity that responds forcefully to the Assailant's attack.

Instrument.arg_desc: An entity used by the Defender fend off the Assailant .

Defending.description: A Defender responds to an Assailant's attack on a Victim by directly, and usually violently, countering it.

Building.description: This frame describes assembly or construction actions, where an Agent joins Components together to form a Created_entity, which is profiled, and hence the object of the verb.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent builds a Created_entity.

Components.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Components that form the Created_entity.

Place.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Place where the building occurs.

Created_entity.arg_desc: Created_entity identifies the entity that is created in the act of building.

Building.description: This frame describes assembly or construction actions, where an Agent joins Components together to form a Created_entity, which is profiled, and hence the object of the verb.

Military_operation.description: The Military of a Possessor (either a nation, institution, or private individual) conducts large-scale activities in a Area to accomplish military or combined military/non-military goals.

Force.arg_desc: The Force carries out the operation. Depending on the size of the operation, this may be as few as one individual or as large as the armed forces of a nation.

Area.arg_desc: The Area in which the Military is conducting operations.

Opponent.arg_desc: The nation, group, or situation which the operation opposes.

Military_operation.description: The Military of a Possessor (either a nation, institution, or private individual) conducts large-scale activities in a Area to accomplish military or combined military/non-military goals.

Self_motion.description: The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path. Alternatively or in addition to Path, an Area, Direction, Source, or Goal for the movement may be mentioned.

Path.arg_desc: Path is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal.  This includes "middle of path'' expressions.

Direction.arg_desc: The direction that the Self_mover heads in during the motion.

Goal.arg_desc: Goal is used for any expression which tells where the Self_mover ends up as a result of the motion.

Source.arg_desc: Source is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion.

Distance.arg_desc: Any expression which characterizes the extent of motion expresses the frame element Distance.

Cotheme.arg_desc: An entity whose motion is correlated with that of the Self_mover, following and tracking the Self_mover, being followed and tracked, or with both parties mutually matching Paths.  We clomped down to the shore with a whole troop of younglings. I had little hope of catching up, but I crawled after her as fast as I could. The troops marching in front of him paid no attention to the beggar by the roadside.

Self_mover.arg_desc: Self_mover is the living being which moves under its own power. Normally it is expressed as an external argument.

Self_motion.description: The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path. Alternatively or in addition to Path, an Area, Direction, Source, or Goal for the movement may be mentioned.

Activity_ready_state.description: The Protagonist is in an initial state, before beginning to be involved in the Activity, but all pre-conditions for performance of the Activity have been satisfied.  In many cases, the Protagonist is an intentional agent, but there are other uses in which the agent is deprofiled, and the Protagonist is an entity which is essential to the Activity.

Protagonist.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Protagonist in the initial state of an activity.

Activity.arg_desc: The action that the Protagonist is prepared to do.

GetReady.description: The Protagonist is in an initial state, before beginning to be involved in the Activity, but all pre-conditions for performance of the Activity have been satisfied.  In many cases, the Protagonist is an intentional agent, but there are other uses in which the agent is deprofiled, and the Protagonist is an entity which is essential to the Activity.

Forming_relationships.description: Partner_1 interacts with Partner_2 (also collectively expressible as Partners) to change their social relationship.

Partner_2.arg_desc: The individual whose relationship with Partner_1 changes.

Partner_1.arg_desc: The individual who comes to form a relationship with Partner_2.

Partners.arg_desc: The individuals whose relationship is changing.

Means.arg_desc: The action that Partner_1 or the Partners take in order to bring about the change in the relationship.

Forming_relationships.description: Partner_1 interacts with Partner_2 (also collectively expressible as Partners) to change their social relationship.

Becoming_a_member.description: A New_member becomes a member of a socially-constructed Group.

Group.arg_desc: The Group is a socially-constructed entity composed of members.

Role.arg_desc: The capacity or role in which the New_member is placed upon joining the Group.

New_member.arg_desc: The New_member becomes a member of a (socially-defined) Group.

Becoming_a_member.description: A New_member becomes a member of a socially-constructed Group.

Enforcing.description: An Agent acts to ensure that a Rule (often a constraint on behavior) is being followed. The Agent's action is according to a general plan for Rules (such that implicit in the Rule is the affordance to certain entities to ensure that the Rule is followed). The Rule may be specified for the Duration for which it is in effect.

Execute_plan.description: An Agent acts according to a Plan, carrying it out (or taking steps to carry it out). In some cases, the Agent is a focal participant in the Plan, although a separate Focal_participant may also be mentioned. The Plan may be specified for the Duration for which it is in effect.

Medium.arg_desc: This FE describes the medium through which the rule was enforced.  It may occur in the same syntactic position as the Agent.

Focal_participant.arg_desc: The individual or group who is obligated to follow the Rule.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent, often an institution, governmental organization, or arm thereof, puts into effect (i.e., enforces) a Rule.

Rule.arg_desc: The Rule is the set of constrants on behavior that the Agent implements (i.e., forces others to obey or face consequences).

Plan.arg_desc: The Plan is a goal or purpose that the Agent carries out.

Execute_plan.description: An Agent acts according to a Plan, carrying it out (or taking steps to carry it out). In some cases, the Agent is a focal participant in the Plan, although a separate Focal_participant may also be mentioned. The Plan may be specified for the Duration for which it is in effect.

Intentionally_act.description: This is an abstract frame for acts performed by sentient beings. It exists mostly for FE inheritance.

Conduct.description: An Agent acts in a certain Manner either generally or under some particular Circumstances. The conduct may also be directed specifically towards an Affected_party.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent performs the intentional act.

Act.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Act that the Agent performs intentionally.

Domain.arg_desc: The Domain within which the Agent acts.

Affected_party.arg_desc: A person to whom behavior is directed by the Agent.

Manner.arg_desc: This FE marks expressions that characterize the way that the Agent behaves.

Action.description: This is an abstract frame for acts performed by sentient beings. It exists mostly for FE inheritance.

Removing.description: An Agent causes a Theme to move away from a location, the Source.  The Sourceis profiled by the words in this frame, just as the Goal is profiled in the Placing frame.

Removing_scenario.description: The abstract scene in which an Agent affects a Source and a Theme so that the Theme ends up not co-located with the Source.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent is the person (or other force) that causes the Theme to move.

Goal.arg_desc: The Goal is the location where the Theme ends up. This Frame Element is not profiled by words in this frame, though it may occasionally be expressed, as with the word remove.

Cause.arg_desc: The non-Agentive cause of the removing event.

Source.arg_desc: The Source is the initial location of the Theme, before it changes location.

Theme.arg_desc: Theme is the object that changes location.

Removing.description: An Agent causes a Theme to move away from a location, the Source.  The Sourceis profiled by the words in this frame, just as the Goal is profiled in the Placing frame.

Surrendering.description: In this frame a Fugitive presents himself or herself to the Authorities to be subject to the criminal process.  The bank robber surrendered to Berkeley police.   Norte is expected to surrender to police tomorrow on tax fraud charges .

Fugitive.arg_desc: The Fugitive is wanted by the Authorities and turns himself or herself in to the Authorities.

Charges.arg_desc: The Charges is the offense for which the Fugitive is wanted.

Authorities.arg_desc: The Authorities are the officials, government or otherwise, who are in charge of initiating the criminal process.

Surrendering.description: In this frame a Fugitive presents himself or herself to the Authorities to be subject to the criminal process.  The bank robber surrendered to Berkeley police.   Norte is expected to surrender to police tomorrow on tax fraud charges .

Surrendering_possession.description: A Surrenderer is compelled to transfer a Theme to a Recipient.

Surrenderer.arg_desc: The person compelled to transfer the Theme to the Recipient.

Recipient.arg_desc: The entity that ends up in possession of the Theme.

Theme.arg_desc: The object that changes possession.

Surrendering_possession.description: A Surrenderer is compelled to transfer a Theme to a Recipient.

Agree_or_refuse_to_act.description: A Speaker either agrees to or refuses to engage in a Proposed_action, proposed by an Interlocutor.

Interlocutor.arg_desc: This is the person who proposed the Proposed_action  to the Speaker and to whom the Speaker communicates  their response.

Speaker.arg_desc: The Speaker is the person to whom a particular action has been proposed and who responds to the request or offer made.

Proposed_action.arg_desc: The Proposed_action is an action that the Speaker would perform if they were to accept or refuse the request or offer.

Agree_or_refuse_to_act.description: A Speaker either agrees to or refuses to engage in a Proposed_action, proposed by an Interlocutor.

Participation.description: An Event with multiple Participants takes place. It can be presented either symmetrically with Participants or asymmetrically, giving Participant_1 greater prominence over Participant_2. If the Event is engaged in intentionally, then there is typically a shared Purpose between the Participants. It is, however, possible that an expressed Purpose only applies to Participant_1.

Participants.arg_desc: The individuals or entities that have been participants in an Event.

Event.arg_desc: An Event with multiple Participants, who may or may not be involved intentionally.

Participation.description: An Event with multiple Participants takes place. It can be presented either symmetrically with Participants or asymmetrically, giving Participant_1 greater prominence over Participant_2. If the Event is engaged in intentionally, then there is typically a shared Purpose between the Participants. It is, however, possible that an expressed Purpose only applies to Participant_1.

Deciding.description: A Cognizer makes a Decision, which may be about an entity or a course of action.

Waver_between_options.description: A Cognizer faces a choice on some Issue. They have several Options  available but keep changing their mind between Option_1 and Option_2. The Cognizer may in fact act on their choice at some point but they need not; the Options can simply be considered for some time with one being favored for a while and then the other.

Cognizer.arg_desc: The Cognizer is the person who repeatedly changes their mind about which of the Options to choose.

Decision.arg_desc: Decision identifies the entity or course of action upon which the Cognizer decides.

Issue.arg_desc: The Issue is a question about a course of action or a choice between items.

Options.arg_desc: The Options are the alternative courses of action or the alternative physical or concrete entities that the Cognizer can choose from.

Deciding.description: A Cognizer makes a Decision, which may be about an entity or a course of action.

Education_teaching.description: This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.  A Student comes to learn either about a Subject; a Skill; a Precept; or a Fact as a result of instruction by a Teacher.

Course.arg_desc: FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject

Skill.arg_desc: An action which the Student is able to perform as a result of instruction.

Teacher.arg_desc: One who instructs a Student in some area of knowledge or skill.

Fact.arg_desc: A piece of information that the Student is informed of by the Teacher.

Student.arg_desc: One who is instructed by a Teacher in skills or knowledge.

Precept.arg_desc: A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.

Role.arg_desc: A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the Student is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.

Subject.arg_desc: The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a Teacher or to a Student.

Education_teaching.description: This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.  A Student comes to learn either about a Subject; a Skill; a Precept; or a Fact as a result of instruction by a Teacher.

Emptying.description: These are words relating to emptying containers and clearing areas of some substance or items. The area or container can appear as the direct object with all these verbs, and is designated  Source because it is the source of motion of the Theme. Corresponding to its nuclear argument status, it is also affected in some crucial way, unlike Source in other frames. Some words in this frame, such as empty, may also occur with Path or Goal expressions, e.g.

Container_focused_removing.description: An Agent or Cause partially or totally changes the state of a Source object, towards having less of the Theme.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent is the entity that does the emptying.

Instrument.arg_desc: This is the object with which the Agent empties the Source.

Source.arg_desc: The Source is the region or container which is emptied of something.  In this frame, the Source occurs as an NP Object. Pat cleared the table.

Theme.arg_desc: The Theme, when overtly expressed, invariably occurs in a PP Complement headed by "of".

Cause.arg_desc: The Cause is the non-sentient force which instigates the emptying. A basic washing can degrease your workclothes.

Emptying.description: These are words relating to emptying containers and clearing areas of some substance or items. The area or container can appear as the direct object with all these verbs, and is designated  Source because it is the source of motion of the Theme. Corresponding to its nuclear argument status, it is also affected in some crucial way, unlike Source in other frames. Some words in this frame, such as empty, may also occur with Path or Goal expressions, e.g.

Getting.description: A Recipient starts off without the Theme in their possession, and then comes to possess it.  Although the Source from which the Theme came is logically necessary, the Recipient and its changing relationship to the Theme is profiled.

Post_getting.description: The stage after which the Recipient has acquired the Theme.

Source.arg_desc: The Source is the location that the Theme formerly occupied.  Persons that begin in possession of the Theme may metonymically stand in for the Source.

Recipient.arg_desc: The Recipient indicates the entity that ends up in possession of the Theme.

Beneficiary.arg_desc: The Beneficiary is an entity which the Recipient passes the Theme to, or shares the Theme with.

Theme.arg_desc: The Theme is the object that changes possession.

Means.arg_desc: The Means is the action of the Recipient which results in their possession of the Theme.

Getting.description: A Recipient starts off without the Theme in their possession, and then comes to possess it.  Although the Source from which the Theme came is logically necessary, the Recipient and its changing relationship to the Theme is profiled.

Besieging.description: An Assailant, a group of armed forces, surrounds the Victim, a military location and the people within it, in an attempt to cut the Victim off from the outside, with the goal of either forcing their surrender or weakening them so that an invasion would be successful. A successful siege is often followed by the Assailant taking control of (the land held by) the Victim.

Place.arg_desc: This FE identifies the place where the Assailant makes an assault on the Victim.

Victim.arg_desc: The Victim is the fortification or geopolitical entity that is being attacked.

Weapon.arg_desc: An entity used by the Assailant to cause damage to the Victim.

Assailant.arg_desc: The Assailant is a group of armed forces (or, metonymically, their commander or the organization they represent) that encircles, surrounds, or otherwise cuts off the Beseiged in an attempt to force surrender.

Besieging.description: An Assailant, a group of armed forces, surrounds the Victim, a military location and the people within it, in an attempt to cut the Victim off from the outside, with the goal of either forcing their surrender or weakening them so that an invasion would be successful. A successful siege is often followed by the Assailant taking control of (the land held by) the Victim.

Intentionally_create.description: The Creator creates a new entity, the Created_entity, possibly out of Components.

Creating.description: A Cause leads to the formation of a Created_entity.

Coming_up_with.description: Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer creating a new intellectual entity, the Idea. These words are similar to words of physical creation such as build and make, and in some cases may be understood as metaphorically based on such words. However, the Ideas in this frame are predominantly conceptual in nature.

Created_entity.arg_desc: This FE identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates.

Instrument.arg_desc: This FE identifies the instrument with which an Agent intentionally creates a Created_entitiy.

Creator.arg_desc: The Creator creates a created entity.

Components.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Components that are attached together to form a Created_entity.

Cause.arg_desc: An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes.

Recipient.arg_desc: The individual who is intended to receive the Created_entity.

Creating.description: A Cause leads to the formation of a Created_entity.

Process_completed_state.description: A Process is finished and can no longer proceed.

Process_end.description: A Process comes to an end.

Activity_done_state.description: An Agent has completed an Activity.

Cause_to_end.description: An Agent or Cause causes a Process or State to end.

Activity_stop.description: An Agent ceases an Activity without completing it.

Process.arg_desc: This FE identifies the name of the Process that occurs.

Final_subevent.arg_desc: The Final_subevent of an event.The peace march  ended with a prayer.

Agent.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Agent in a done state of an the Activity.
