State.arg_desc: A State which is ended by the Agent or Cause.

Cause.arg_desc: An event that causes the Process or State to end.

Process_end.description: A Process comes to an end.

Gesture.description: The words in this frame have to do with non-verbal communication. Topic is not normally expressed with these words. This seems to be related to the absence of a verbal code in cases of gestural communication. Topic can be viewed as a partial characterization of a Message, but such partial characterization is either difficult or irrelevant in the absence of a verbal code.

Body_movement.description: This frame contains words for motions or actions an Agent performs using some part of his/her body.

Indicated_entity.arg_desc: The Indicated_entity is the entity which the Communicator is pointing out to the Addressee as meaningful.

Body_part.arg_desc: The Body_part is the specific body part of the Communicator which gestures.

Message.arg_desc: This is the content of non-verbal communication. It may be expressed as a that-clause Complement, a to-marked infinitive VP Complement, or a directional PP Complement: The teacher gestured that it was time to leave. The teacher gestured to us to enter the room. The teacher gestured us into the room.

Addressee.arg_desc: This is the person to whom a non-verbal Message is communicated. It may be expressed as an NP Object or as a PP Complement: The teacher gestured us into the room. The teacher gestured to us to enter the room.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent uses some part of his/her body to perform the action. Agent occurs as the External Argument.

Path.arg_desc: Path identifies the trajectory of motion of the Body_part without specifying a start or end point.

Body_movement.description: This frame contains words for motions or actions an Agent performs using some part of his/her body.

Cause_expansion.description: An  Agent or non-human Cause causes an Item to change its physical size.  The Size_change of an Item may be explicitly indicated or characterized in terms of Initial_size and/or Result_size.  In the default case, expansion is along all dimensions, but sometimes the Dimension of expansion is incorporated or made explicit.

Rate.arg_desc: Rate identifies the rate of change of the value.

Cause.arg_desc: The Cause is a non-human entity which brings about the change in size.

Result_size.arg_desc: Result_size is typically expressed in a PP Complement headed by to.

Initial_size.arg_desc: Initial_size is rarely expressed without Result_size also being explicit.  Initial_size generally occurs in a PP-from Complement.

Size_change.arg_desc: Size_change identifies the amount by which the size of an Item changes.

Agent.arg_desc: With some words in this frame, an Agent who causes the change in size of the Item may be present. The Agent typically occurs as the External Argument of a verb.

Dimension.arg_desc: Change of size may be limited to or described in terms of a single Dimension.

Item.arg_desc: The Item is frequently the External Argument of verbs or the NP Object if an Agent is expressed.

Expansion.description: An  Agent or non-human Cause causes an Item to change its physical size.  The Size_change of an Item may be explicitly indicated or characterized in terms of Initial_size and/or Result_size.  In the default case, expansion is along all dimensions, but sometimes the Dimension of expansion is incorporated or made explicit.

Telling.description: A Speaker addresses an Addressee with a Message, which may be indirectly referred to as a Topic. Instead of (or in addition to) a Speaker, a Medium may also be mentioned.

Addressee.arg_desc: The Addressee receives the Message from the Speaker.

Message.arg_desc: The Message is the communication produced by the Speaker.

Speaker.arg_desc: The Speaker is the sentient entity that produces the Message.

Medium.arg_desc: This FE is the Medium in which the Message is expressed.

Telling.description: A Speaker addresses an Addressee with a Message, which may be indirectly referred to as a Topic. Instead of (or in addition to) a Speaker, a Medium may also be mentioned.

Cause_change.description: An Agent or Cause causes an Entity to change, either in its category membership or in terms of the value of an Attribute. In the former case, an Initial_category and a Final_category may be expressed, in the latter case an Initial_value and a Final_value can be specified.

Final_category.arg_desc: The category that the Entity belongs to after it has undergone the change.

Attribute.arg_desc: A characteristic of the Entity for which a value can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement , or observation.

Agent.arg_desc: The sentient entity that effects a change in the Entity.

Initial_value.arg_desc: The value that the Attribute has before the change takes place.

Cause.arg_desc: An event that causes a change in the Entity.

Final_value.arg_desc: The value that the Attribute assumes as a result of the change that the Entity is caused to undergo.

Entity.arg_desc: The abstract or concrete thing or situation that the Agent causes to change.

Initial_category.arg_desc: The category of which the Entity is a member before the Agent causes a change.

Change.description: An Agent or Cause causes an Entity to change, either in its category membership or in terms of the value of an Attribute. In the former case, an Initial_category and a Final_category may be expressed, in the latter case an Initial_value and a Final_value can be specified.

Cause_change_of_phase.description: A Cause or Agent causes a Patient to undergo a change of phase.  The Result of the change may be given, along with the Initial_state and the Circumstances under which the change can occur.  Note that this frame contrasts with Cause_change_of_consistency in that this frame describes causation of a change of a Patient between different phases (i.e. solid to liquid or frozen to "unfrozen").   Bob melted the butter.    Sally defrosted the chicken to eat for dinner.

Hot_cold_source.arg_desc: The Hot_cold_source is the source of the heat or cool.   We  froze  the fish  on ice  .

Patient.arg_desc: The Patient undergoes a change of phase brought about by the Agent.

Cause.arg_desc: The Cause is the non-Agent which brings about the change in the Patient. The sun melted the ice.

Result.arg_desc: Result is the result of the change of phase.  the butter  was melted to a runny consistency

Instrument.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Instrument with which the Agent intentionally affects the Patient.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent causes the Patient to change phase.

Medium.arg_desc: The Medium is the substance which surrounds the Patient and facilitates its phase change.

Initial_state.arg_desc: This is the original state of the Patient. The rock  was solidified  from its molten state  .

Cause_change_of_phase.description: A Cause or Agent causes a Patient to undergo a change of phase.  The Result of the change may be given, along with the Initial_state and the Circumstances under which the change can occur.  Note that this frame contrasts with Cause_change_of_consistency in that this frame describes causation of a change of a Patient between different phases (i.e. solid to liquid or frozen to "unfrozen").   Bob melted the butter.    Sally defrosted the chicken to eat for dinner.

Legal_rulings.description: An Authority with the power to make decisions hands down a Finding over a question presented in a formal or informal Case.

Defendant.arg_desc: The person about whom the Authority passes a judgment or Finding.

Authority.arg_desc: The Authority (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the Finding.

Case.arg_desc: This FE describes the question on which the Authority gives a Finding.

Finding.arg_desc: This FE identifies the outcome of the Authority's deliberation or consideration.

Legal_basis.arg_desc: This FE indicates the basis in law of a Finding.

Legal_rulings.description: An Authority with the power to make decisions hands down a Finding over a question presented in a formal or informal Case.

Bearing_arms.description: A Protagonist has (or does not have) a Weapon.  The Degree to which the Protagonist is armed may also be described.  The Protagonist is normally a human but may be a device that has subsidiary weapons.

Protagonist.arg_desc: The individual that possesses a Weapon.

Weapon.arg_desc: The destructive device that the Protagonist has with them.

Bearing_arms.description: A Protagonist has (or does not have) a Weapon.  The Degree to which the Protagonist is armed may also be described.  The Protagonist is normally a human but may be a device that has subsidiary weapons.

Conferring_benefit.description: A Benefactor confers a Beneficial_situation to a Beneficiary.  Unlike in Commerce_scenario, the recipient is not necessarily required to pay for the good or service that they receive.  Therefore, the element of benevolence is profiled.

Offering.description: An Offerer indicates that he or she is able and willing to give a Theme to a Potential_recipient. In the absence of further qualifications, it is often understood that the Potential_recipient accepts the Theme.

Giving.description: A Donor transfers a Theme from a Donor to a Recipient.  This frame includes only actions that are initiated by the Donor (the one that starts out owning the Theme).  Sentences (even metaphorical ones) must meet the following entailments: the  Donor first has possession of the Theme.  Following the transfer the Donor no longer has the Theme and the Recipient does. Barney gave the beer to Moe. $300 was endowed to the university to build a new performing arts building.

Post_giving.description: The stage immediately after the Donor gives the Recipient the Theme, i.e. when the Recipient has possession of the Theme and the Donor no longer does.

Offerer.arg_desc: The person that begins in possession of the Theme and offers it to the Potential_recipient .

Theme.arg_desc: The object that changes ownership.

Recipient.arg_desc: The entity that ends up in possession of the Theme.

Giving.description: A Donor transfers a Theme from a Donor to a Recipient.  This frame includes only actions that are initiated by the Donor (the one that starts out owning the Theme).  Sentences (even metaphorical ones) must meet the following entailments: the  Donor first has possession of the Theme.  Following the transfer the Donor no longer has the Theme and the Recipient does. Barney gave the beer to Moe. $300 was endowed to the university to build a new performing arts building.

Name_conferral.description: This  frame contains words that talk about how Speakers name Entities.

Name.arg_desc: The linguistic expression by which Speakers refer to the Entity.

Entity.arg_desc: The entity that Speakers refer to by using the Name.

Speaker.arg_desc: The person who uses the linguistic expression (Name) to refer to the Referent.

Explanation.arg_desc: The Explanation of the intentional act.

Name_conferral.description: This  frame contains words that talk about how Speakers name Entities.

Arranging.description: An Agent puts a complex Theme into a particular Configuration, which can be a proper order, a correct or suitable sequence, or a spatial position.

Location.arg_desc: The place in which the Theme is put into a Configuration.

Theme.arg_desc: An entity that consists of  parts which can be put into a configuration relative to each other and/or relative to their environment.

Configuration.arg_desc: A state that holds of the Theme or a relation that holds among the constituent parts of the Theme as a result of the arranging action.

Agent.arg_desc: The person who causes the Theme to be in a particular Configuration.

Arranging.description: An Agent puts a complex Theme into a particular Configuration, which can be a proper order, a correct or suitable sequence, or a spatial position.

Making_arrangements.description: An Agent performs a series of unspecified tasks to plan for an Event to take place at a Scheduled_time and Place.

Scheduled_time.arg_desc: The time for which the Agent has arranged the Event.

Agent.arg_desc: The person who makes arrangements for the Event to take place at a Time and Place.

Event.arg_desc: The incident for which the Agent has made arrangements.

Beneficiary.arg_desc: The person for whom the Event was arranged.

Making_arrangements.description: An Agent performs a series of unspecified tasks to plan for an Event to take place at a Scheduled_time and Place.

Use_firearm.description: An Agent causes a Firearm to discharge, usually directing the projectile from the barrel of the Firearm (the Source), along a Path, and to a Goal.

Firearm.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Firearm that an Agent activates so that it rapidly propels a projectile.

Path.arg_desc: This is the path along which the projectiles travel.

Source.arg_desc: The Source is the location of the Firearm from which projectiles originate.

Agent.arg_desc: The self-directed entity that uses and activates the Firearm.

Goal.arg_desc: Goal is the location the Theme ends up in, or is intended to end up in.

Use_firearm.description: An Agent causes a Firearm to discharge, usually directing the projectile from the barrel of the Firearm (the Source), along a Path, and to a Goal.

Committing_crime.description: A Perpetrator (generally intentionally) commits a Crime, i.e. does something not permitted by the laws of society.

Misdeed.description: A Wrongdoer engages in a Misdeed.

Offenses.description: Words in this frame describe acts in violation of a legal code.

Crime.arg_desc: An act, generally intentional, that has been formally forbidden by law.

Means.arg_desc: An action performed by the Perpetrator in order to accomplish the Crime.

Instrument.arg_desc: The Instrument used in committing the crime.

Perpetrator.arg_desc: The individual that commits a Crime.

Punishment.arg_desc: This FE denotes the Punishment that is specified by the statute in which the offense is defined.

Victim.arg_desc: This FE denotes the person or entity that is badly affected by the Offense.

Committing_crime.description: A Perpetrator (generally intentionally) commits a Crime, i.e. does something not permitted by the laws of society.

Assistance.description: A Helper benefits a Benefited_party by enabling the culmination of a Goal that the Benefited_party has.  A Focal_entity that is involved in reaching the Goal may stand in for it.

Instrument.arg_desc: An entity used by the Helper in service of the Benefited_party's accomplishing their Goal.

Means.arg_desc: An action that the Helper undertakes in service of the Benefited_party's Goal.

Helper.arg_desc: The Helper performs some action that benefits the Benefited_party.

Benefited_party.arg_desc: The Benefited_party receives a benefit from the action of the Helper.

Focal_entity.arg_desc: This FE identifies a Focal_entity involved in achieving the Goal.

Goal.arg_desc: The desirable state of affairs that the Benefited_party is involved in and which is enabled by the Helper.

Assistance.description: A Helper benefits a Benefited_party by enabling the culmination of a Goal that the Benefited_party has.  A Focal_entity that is involved in reaching the Goal may stand in for it.

Surrounding.description: A Figure surrounds a Ground.  The Ground location is presented as more likely to be a known location than the location of the Figure. Some lexical units entail more-or-less complete surrounding in two or three dimensions (e.g. surround.v), while others entail surrounding on only two sides (e.g. astride.prep, straddle.v).  Like other locative relations, the Figure may be any of a movable entity, an immovable entity, or an event.

Ground.arg_desc: The Ground is the area that the Figure surrounds.

Figure.arg_desc: The Figure is the entity located with respect to the Ground.

Surrounding.description: A Figure surrounds a Ground.  The Ground location is presented as more likely to be a known location than the location of the Figure. Some lexical units entail more-or-less complete surrounding in two or three dimensions (e.g. surround.v), while others entail surrounding on only two sides (e.g. astride.prep, straddle.v).  Like other locative relations, the Figure may be any of a movable entity, an immovable entity, or an event.

Quarreling.description: A group of Arguers (also expressible as Arguer1 and Arguer2) express incompatible opinions or beliefs about an Issue.

Arguer2.arg_desc: The person who is being argued with by Arguer1.

Arguers.arg_desc: A group of people in an argument.

Issue.arg_desc: The the thing the the Arguers are arguing over or about.

Arguer1.arg_desc: A person who is arguing with Arguer2.

Medium.arg_desc: The equipment, language, or other entity that the Arguers use to pursue their argument.

Quarreling.description: A group of Arguers (also expressible as Arguer1 and Arguer2) express incompatible opinions or beliefs about an Issue.

Expend_resource.description: An Agent uses a Resource which is consumed and unavailable for future use.

Means.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Means by which an Agent exhausts the Resource.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent uses the Resource.

Resource.arg_desc: The Resource is exhausted over time by being used.

Expend_resource.description: An Agent uses a Resource which is consumed and unavailable for future use.

Motion_directional.description: In this frame a Theme moves in a certain Direction which is often determined by gravity or other natural, physical forces. The Theme is not necessarily a self-mover.

Intentional_traversing.description: A Self_mover intentionally moves in a Directionon a Path relative to landmark that is neither the Source nor the Goal of the overall motion. The shape or configuration of the Path may be expressed with a Path_shape

Traversing.description: A Theme changes location with respect to a salient location, which can be expressed by a Source, Path, Goal, Area, Direction, Path_shape, or Distance, as shown in the examples below:

Speed.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Speed at which the motion occurs.

Source.arg_desc: The Source is the location the Theme occupies before the Motion occurs.  The man toppled from the passenger seat into the road.

Path.arg_desc: Path refers to (a part of) the ground over which the Theme travels  or to a landmark past which the Theme travels.

Area.arg_desc: This FE identifies the general Area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path.

Theme.arg_desc: The Theme is the entity that changes location.

Direction.arg_desc: The direction of motion of the Theme.  Direction characterizes the Path of motion according to some system of orientation, most often that imposed by gravity.

Goal.arg_desc: The Goal is the location the Theme ends up in (often unintentionally).

Distance.arg_desc: Distance identifies a phrase that characterizes the extent of motion of the Theme.

Motion_directional.description: In this frame a Theme moves in a certain Direction which is often determined by gravity or other natural, physical forces. The Theme is not necessarily a self-mover.

Bringing.description: This frame concerns the movement of a Theme and an Agent and/or Carrier.   The Agent, a person or other sentient entity, controls the shared Path by moving the Theme during the motion. In other words, the Agent has overall motion in directing the motion of the Theme.  The Carrier may be a separate entity, or it may be the Agent's body. The Constant_location may be a subregion of the Agent's body or (a subregion of) a vehicle that the Agent uses.

Source.arg_desc: Source indicates the beginning of the path along which the Theme travels.

Theme.arg_desc: The objects being carried.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent is a sentient being who physically controls the movement of the Theme via the carrier, accompanying the Theme.

Carrier.arg_desc: The Carrier provides support for the Theme.  Movement of the Carrier results in movement of the Theme.

Beneficiary.arg_desc: This FE describes the particpant for whom the bringing is beneficial.

Area.arg_desc: Area is used for descriprion of a general area in which the carrying action takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path.

Goal.arg_desc: Goal identifies the endpoint of the path.

Bringing.description: This frame concerns the movement of a Theme and an Agent and/or Carrier.   The Agent, a person or other sentient entity, controls the shared Path by moving the Theme during the motion. In other words, the Agent has overall motion in directing the motion of the Theme.  The Carrier may be a separate entity, or it may be the Agent's body. The Constant_location may be a subregion of the Agent's body or (a subregion of) a vehicle that the Agent uses.

Chatting.description: A group of people (the Interlocutors or Interlocutor_1 and Interlocutor_2 together) have a conversation.  No person is construed as only a speaker or only an addressee. Rather, it is understood that both (or all) participants do some speaking and some listening--the process is understood to be symmetrical or reciprocal.  In this frame, the purpose of the conversation is generally social, rather than specifically to decide something or exchange information, or to quarrel (see Discussion and Quarreling).

Talking_into.description: A Speaker expresses through language his wish to get the Addressee to act.  The Addressee forms an intention to act and does so.

Communication_response.description: This frame deals with a Speaker communicating a reply or response, a Message, to some prior communication or action, the Trigger.

Encoding.description: A person (Speaker) expresses a Message or mental content, broadly understood, in a particular Manner. The content may be emotional, as in Humans express  feelings through words intellectual, as in Formulate the idea carefully  or linguistic, as in Phrase your question as a comment.

Contacting.description: A Communicator (whose Location may be indicated) directs a Communication to an Addressee at a particular Address.  Note that no actual successful communicative act is implied, only the successful completion of acts which would establish the communication.  (In other words, Mari can e-mail Jon without Jon ever reading it.) NB:  The Address or Location_of_communicator may be a virtual address, such as an e-mail or telephone number.Disgruntled voters phoned Congressman Neil at his Washington residence with complaints about the recent increases in corporate welfare.She tried to call from the payphone down the street.

Discussion.description: Two (or more) people (the Interlocutors, also encodable as Interlocutor_1 and Interlocutor_2) talk to one another. No person is construed as only a speaker or only an addressee. Rather, it is understood that both (or all) participants do some speaking and some listening--the process is understood to be symmetrical or reciprocal.  This frame differs from the Chatting frame in that the Interlocutors have a particular question that they are attempting to decide or understand.

Successfully_communicate_message.description: A Communicator speaks to an Addressee in such a way that the Addressee understands and fully appreciates the truth and/or relevance of the Message.

Communication.description: A Communicator conveys a Message to an Addressee; the Topic and Medium of the communication also may be expressed.  This frame includes no specification of the method of communication (speech, writing, gesture, etc.).  This frame and the frames that inherit the general Communication frame can add elaboration to the Medium in a variety of ways (in French, on the radio program, in a letter) or to the Manner of communication (babble, rant, shout, whisper). There are also frames related to Communication that either do not inherit all of the FEs of this frame or do not inherit them in a straightforward manner (such as Conversation, in which Communicator and Addressee alternate roles, and are often expressed by a single, plural NP).

Language.arg_desc: The language(s) or dialect(s) that a conversation is conducted in.

Interlocutors.arg_desc: The group of individuals involved in chatting.

Topic.arg_desc: The general subject that the statements of the Interlocutors in the conversation pertain to.

Means_of_communication.arg_desc: The device used by the Interlocutors to communicate.

Content.arg_desc: The wish for action on the Addressee's part  that the Speaker expresses.

Addressee.arg_desc: The person that the Speaker seeks to influence to act.

Speaker.arg_desc: The Speaker intends through the use of language to get another person to act.

Means.arg_desc: Act of the Speaker that enables them to persuade the Addressee.

Trigger.arg_desc: The Trigger is the prior communication or action to which a response is given. It can occur as an NP Object or a PP Complement.Sue answered the question.Sue responded to the questionnaire.

Message.arg_desc: The Message is the FE that identifies the content of what the Speaker is communicating to the Addressee. It can be expressed as a direct quote or a clause."I can't help you," Sue answered.Sue replied that she couldn't help.

Medium.arg_desc: As with Medium in other Communication frames, the physical entity or channel used to communicate can be expressed, usually as a PP Complement headed by "on" or "in":Sue responded to my question on the telephone.Sue replied in writing.

Communication.description: A Communicator conveys a Message to an Addressee; the Topic and Medium of the communication also may be expressed.  This frame includes no specification of the method of communication (speech, writing, gesture, etc.).  This frame and the frames that inherit the general Communication frame can add elaboration to the Medium in a variety of ways (in French, on the radio program, in a letter) or to the Manner of communication (babble, rant, shout, whisper). There are also frames related to Communication that either do not inherit all of the FEs of this frame or do not inherit them in a straightforward manner (such as Conversation, in which Communicator and Addressee alternate roles, and are often expressed by a single, plural NP).

Containing.description: In this frame a Container holds within its physical boundaries the Contents.

Contents.arg_desc: The Contents is the substance or objects contained within the physical bounds of the Container.

Container.arg_desc: The Container is the physical object which holds within its boundaries the Contents

Containing.description: In this frame a Container holds within its physical boundaries the Contents.

Manufacturing.description: A Producer produces a Product from a Resource for commercial purposes.

Consumer.arg_desc: The Producer produces the Product for the Consumer.

Product.arg_desc: The Product is produced by the Producer.

Factory.arg_desc: Factory identifies the particular plant where the Product is manufactured.

Resource.arg_desc: Resource is the material that the product is made from.

Producer.arg_desc: The person or company that produces the Product.

Instrument.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Instrument with which a Producer

Manufacturing.description: A Producer produces a Product from a Resource for commercial purposes.

Social_event_individuals.description: This frames describes a social event where there may or may not be a permanent or semi-permanent relationship between participants. Additionally, participants in this frame are expressed separately, as Party_1 and Party_2.  Note the difference between this frame and Social_event_collective, where participants are grouped into one collective grammatical constituent and FE.

Social_event_collective.description: This frames describes a social event where there may or may not be a permanent or semi-permanent relationship between participants. Additionally, participants in this frame are expressed in one representative FE, Attendees.  Note the difference between this frame and Social_event_individuals, where participants are grammatically separated.

Social_event.description: A Social_event occurs at which Attendees are present to conduct a social function or joint activity.  The Social_event is often a party or celebration, in which case it is possible to express someone who is being honored (the Honoree) or its function may be to celebrate an Occasion at which Attendees are present. Often, a specific Attendee, the Host, provides a venue for people to gather.

Party_2.arg_desc: Party_2 is the grammatically less prominent participant in the social event.  Party_2 can be one or more individuals.

Party_1.arg_desc: Party_1 is the grammatically more prominent participant in the social event.  Party_1 can be one or more individuals.

Attendees.arg_desc: The Attendees are the collectively construed participants of the social event.

Beneficiary.arg_desc: The person for whom the Social_event is held.

Occasion.arg_desc: The Occasion for which the Social_event is held.

Host.arg_desc: The Host is the person or organization that hosts the Social_event.  In cases where an individual stands in for an organization, the host may be marked twice.

Social_event.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Social_event itself.

Social_event.description: A Social_event occurs at which Attendees are present to conduct a social function or joint activity.  The Social_event is often a party or celebration, in which case it is possible to express someone who is being honored (the Honoree) or its function may be to celebrate an Occasion at which Attendees are present. Often, a specific Attendee, the Host, provides a venue for people to gather.

Robbery.description: These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator wrongs a Victim by taking something (Goods) from them.  In some cases, the Source location from which the Goods were taken is used to metonymically refer to the Victim.  The robbery can be done in a particular Manner (for example, forcefully) and via a specific Means (for example, by threatening the Victim).

Perpetrator.arg_desc: The Perpetrator is the person (or other agent) that takes the Goods away by force or threats.  Leslie robbed Kim of her watch.

Goods.arg_desc: The Goods are anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be taken away.

Place.arg_desc: The Place is where the Robbery occurs.

Means.arg_desc: The Means indicates the means by which the Robbery takes place.

Source.arg_desc: Source is the initial location of the goods, before they change location.

Victim.arg_desc: The Victim is the person (or other sentient being or group) that owns the Goods before they are taken away by the Perpetrator.

Robbery.description: These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator wrongs a Victim by taking something (Goods) from them.  In some cases, the Source location from which the Goods were taken is used to metonymically refer to the Victim.  The robbery can be done in a particular Manner (for example, forcefully) and via a specific Means (for example, by threatening the Victim).

Competition.description: This frame is concerned with the idea that people (Participant_1, Participant_2, or Participants) participate in an organized, rule-governed activity (the Competition) in order to achieve some advantageous outcome (often the Prize).  Rank and Score are different criteria by which the degree of achievement of the advantageous outcome is judged.

Participants.arg_desc: This FE is used for plural NP participants in a competition.

Venue.arg_desc: This FE is for the named venue of a competition, particularly when the place has been built for the purpose of a competition.

Competition.arg_desc: This FE is used for the name of the competition.

Prize.arg_desc: This FE indicates a prize won in a competition.

Competition.description: This frame is concerned with the idea that people (Participant_1, Participant_2, or Participants) participate in an organized, rule-governed activity (the Competition) in order to achieve some advantageous outcome (often the Prize).  Rank and Score are different criteria by which the degree of achievement of the advantageous outcome is judged.

Text_creation.description: An Author creates a Text, either written, such as a letter, or spoken, such as a speech,  that contains meaningful linguistic tokens, and may have a particular Addressee in mind.  The Text may include information about its topic, although the latter is not an FE in this frame.

Author.arg_desc: The Author produces a particular Text.

Instrument.arg_desc: The instrument with which an intentional act is performed.

Medium.arg_desc: The language in which the Text is represented or the physical materials upon which the Text is recorded.

Addressee.arg_desc: This is the person to whom the Message is communicated. When this FE is expressed, it often appears in a prepositional phrase introduced by to, or as the direct object, or as the first object in a double object construction.

Text.arg_desc: The entity which results from the act of writing or speaking.

Writing.description: An Author creates a Text, either written, such as a letter, or spoken, such as a speech,  that contains meaningful linguistic tokens, and may have a particular Addressee in mind.  The Text may include information about its topic, although the latter is not an FE in this frame.

Rescuing.description: An Agent saves a Patient or an Asset from a Harmful_situation.

Means.arg_desc: The means by which the Agent rescues the Patient or Asset.

Agent.arg_desc: The sentient being who rescues the Patient or Asset from the Harmful_situation.

Patient.arg_desc: The living being who is rescued by the Agent.

Instrument.arg_desc: The tool with which the Agent saves the Patient or Asset.

Harmful_situation.arg_desc: An event that occurs which could result in injury or harm to the Patient or Asset.

Asset.arg_desc: The entity that is judged to be valueable which might be lost or damaged by the Harmful_situation.

Rescuing.description: An Agent saves a Patient or an Asset from a Harmful_situation.

Judgment_communication.description: A Communicator communicates a judgment of an Evaluee to an Addressee.  The judgment may be positive (e.g. praise) or negative (e.g. criticize), and this is indicated by the semantic types Positive and Negative attached to the lexical units.  This frame does not contain words where Evaluee and the Addressee are necessarily the same .

Judgment_direct_address.description: In this frame, a Communicator judges the Addressee and then communicates that appraisal directly to the Addressee. The judgment is given for a particular Reason or about a particular Topic.

Topic.arg_desc: The Topic is the subject on which the Addressee is being judged.

Reason.arg_desc: Typically, there is a constituent expressing the Reason for the Communicator's judgment. It is usually a for-PP.

Medium.arg_desc: Medium identifies the physical or abstract setting in which the evaluation is conveyed.

Evaluee.arg_desc: A judgment is made about the Evaluee  With verbs this FE is typically expressed as Object:

Addressee.arg_desc: The Addressee hears the judgement from the Communicator.

Communicator.arg_desc: The Communicator uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey his or her evaluation of the Evaluee to another person.  Jon belittled Madie to her colleagues.

Judgment_communication.description: A Communicator communicates a judgment of an Evaluee to an Addressee.  The judgment may be positive (e.g. praise) or negative (e.g. criticize), and this is indicated by the semantic types Positive and Negative attached to the lexical units.  This frame does not contain words where Evaluee and the Addressee are necessarily the same .

Change_tool.description: An Agent changes Tools, from the Old_tool to a New_tool.  The Tools may include vehicles, services providers, or more proto-typical implements.

New_tool.arg_desc: The tool that the Agent ends up using.

Agent.arg_desc: The individual that changes their situation.

Old_tool.arg_desc: The tool that the Agent had been using.

Tools.arg_desc: The entities controlled by an Agent to achieve some Purpose.

Change_tool.description: An Agent changes Tools, from the Old_tool to a New_tool.  The Tools may include vehicles, services providers, or more proto-typical implements.

Manipulation.description: The words in this frame describe the manipulation of an Entity by an Agent.  Generally, this implies that the Entity is not deeply or permanently physically affected, nor is it overall moved from one place to another.

Manipulate_into_doing.description: A Manipulator gets his Victim to perform a Resulting_action against what their better judgment would have been at the time. The means by which the Manipulator overcomes or bypasses the Victim's resistance to act need not be linguistic expression.  In some cases, the Goods may stand in for a Resulting_action of the Victim giving the Manipulator the Goods.

Means.arg_desc: An action by the Agent to accomplish the desired manipulation.

Entity.arg_desc: The Entity being manipulated often occurs as the direct object of verbs:

Instrument.arg_desc: An entity directed by the Agent that interacts with the Entity to accomplish the action indicated by the target.

Resulting_action.arg_desc: What the Manipulator intends to make the Victim do and the Victim actually does.

Manipulator.arg_desc: The person who gets the Victim to act against their interest.

Goods.arg_desc: The FE goods is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be taken away.

Hold.description: The words in this frame describe the manipulation of an Entity by an Agent.  Generally, this implies that the Entity is not deeply or permanently physically affected, nor is it overall moved from one place to another.

Being_in_operation.description: A Device or machine is in (or out of) service. Note that being broken or functional is a separate issue from being turned on or off. This latter notion is what the present frame is concerned with.  The Time when and the Place where the Device is in use may be specified, as may be the Purpose a backgrounded human User had in turning the Device on or off.

Being_operational.description: An Object with an understood function is or is not in a state ready to perform that function.

Device.arg_desc: The Device or machine that is in or out of operation.

Being_in_operation.description: A Device or machine is in (or out of) service. Note that being broken or functional is a separate issue from being turned on or off. This latter notion is what the present frame is concerned with.  The Time when and the Place where the Device is in use may be specified, as may be the Purpose a backgrounded human User had in turning the Device on or off.

Recording.description: An Agent sets down in permanent form information about the occurrence of a Phenomenon. Alternatively, the Agent records that an Entity had a particular Value for one of its Attributes.

Entity.arg_desc: An Entity for which the Agent records the Value of an Attribute.

Value.arg_desc: The Value of the Entity that is recorded for the specified Attribute.

Instrument.arg_desc: The Agent uses an Instrument in order to create a record of the Phenomenon or to measure an Entity's Value for a specified Attribute.

Phenomenon.arg_desc: The Phenomenon is the entity or situation in the world of which a Agent becomes aware.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent is the sentient entity that creates a permanent record of the Phenomenon.

Attribute.arg_desc: That feature of the Entity which is under discussion.

Recording.description: An Agent sets down in permanent form information about the occurrence of a Phenomenon. Alternatively, the Agent records that an Entity had a particular Value for one of its Attributes.

Carry_goods.description: A Distributor sells, lends, or otherwise distributes a class of Goods. In the prototypical case, the Distributor is a retailer who generally keeps some type of Goods on site for the purpose of selling it to a buyer. Extensions include lending Goods (e.g., libraries, movie rental outlets), organization-internal distribution (as in a hospital), or other non-commercial distribution centers. The Goods are constrained to be a type of item (e.g., canned goods, antique dressers) rather than a particular or unique item (e.g., Smith's last self-portrait, that guitar I saw here last week). Note that a Distributor may carry some particular goods, but may not have it on hand at that exact moment.

Distributor.arg_desc: The Distributor maintains a store of Goods for the purpose of selling or otherwise distributing them.

Goods.arg_desc: The Goods are kept on hand and distributed by the Distributor.

Carry_goods.description: A Distributor sells, lends, or otherwise distributes a class of Goods. In the prototypical case, the Distributor is a retailer who generally keeps some type of Goods on site for the purpose of selling it to a buyer. Extensions include lending Goods (e.g., libraries, movie rental outlets), organization-internal distribution (as in a hospital), or other non-commercial distribution centers. The Goods are constrained to be a type of item (e.g., canned goods, antique dressers) rather than a particular or unique item (e.g., Smith's last self-portrait, that guitar I saw here last week). Note that a Distributor may carry some particular goods, but may not have it on hand at that exact moment.

Expensiveness.description: A Payer gives up (or potentially gives up) the use of an Asset (generally money) in order to achieve an Intended_event.  This event is often more specifically described as gaining possession of some Goods or receiving a Service.  In the majority of cases, the Payer is described generically (INI), and the situation depicted answers the question of how much of an Asset would have to be given up to receive the Goods or bring about the Intended_event.

Intended_event.arg_desc: The event that the Payer brings about by deploying the Asset.

Payer.arg_desc: The person whose Asset is given up in order to achieve an Intended_event.  This FE is often expressed as INI.

Asset.arg_desc: The price of or payment made for the Goods.

Goods.arg_desc: The FE Goods is the item(s) whose price is being assessed.  Goods is usually an External Argument:

Rate.arg_desc: The amount of an Asset relative to some measure of the Goods

Cost.description: A Payer gives up (or potentially gives up) the use of an Asset (generally money) in order to achieve an Intended_event.  This event is often more specifically described as gaining possession of some Goods or receiving a Service.  In the majority of cases, the Payer is described generically (INI), and the situation depicted answers the question of how much of an Asset would have to be given up to receive the Goods or bring about the Intended_event.

Visitor_departure.description: After a visit is complete, the Agent departs the Source, normally bound for their normal haunts.

Setting_out.description: A Self_mover begins a journey at a Source location, in a particular Directiongenerally setting out with an Intended_goal in mind.

Disembarking.description: A Traveller leaves from or dismounts a Vehicle.

Visit_host_departure.description: A Visitor departs from a Host_location after having visited a Host.

Visiting_scenario_departing.description: An Agent departs from the Source, normally bound for their normal location. This is a point-of-view-neutral conception of the departure.

Departing.description: An object (the Theme) moves away from a Source. The Source may be expressed or it may be understood from context, but its existence is always implied by the departing word itself.

Source.arg_desc: Any constituent that expresses the initial position of the Agent, before the change of location, is tagged with Source. Often the Source is understood from context.

Distance.arg_desc: The distance that the Agent has traveled.

Mode_of_transportation.arg_desc: The Mode_of_transportation expresses how the motion of the Agent is effected, by its body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the Agent. Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium.

Goal.arg_desc: This FE labels any expression which tells where the Agent ends up, or would end up, as a result of departing from the Source.

Path.arg_desc: Any description of the trajectory of the departure which is neither a Source nor a Goal expresses the frame element Path.

Traveller.arg_desc: The Traveller is the entity which disembarks from the Vehicle.

Departing.description: An object (the Theme) moves away from a Source. The Source may be expressed or it may be understood from context, but its existence is always implied by the departing word itself.

Abandonment.description: An Agent leaves behind a Theme effectively rendering it no longer within their control or of the normal security as one's property.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent is the person who acts to leave behind the Theme.

Theme.arg_desc: The Theme is the entity that is relinguished to no one from the Agent's possession.

Means.arg_desc: An action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the action indicated by the target.

GiveUp.description: An Agent leaves behind a Theme effectively rendering it no longer within their control or of the normal security as one's property.

Change_of_leadership.description: This frame concerns the appointment of a New_leader or removal from office of an Old_leader.  The Selector brings about the change in leadership, for example, by electing or overthrowing a leader. Some words in the frame describe the successful removal from office of a leader (e.g. depose, oust), others simply the attempt (e.g. uprising, rebellion).

Old_order.arg_desc: The FE Old_order identifies the political order that existed before the change of leadership occurs.

New_leader.arg_desc: With words denoting appointment to a position, the New_leader is typically the object of verbs.

Selector.arg_desc: The Selector (most commonly a group of people) is responsible for a change in leadership.  Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs.

Body.arg_desc: A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function of governance.

Function.arg_desc: The Function is the purpose the New_leader will fufill.

Role.arg_desc: Frequently the Old_leader or New_leader is referred to only by his/her role. However, the Role can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement.

Old_leader.arg_desc: With words denoting removal (or attempted removal) from office of a leader, the Old_leader is typically the direct object of verbs, or occurs in a PP Complement with noun targets, frequently headed by the preposition against.

Change_of_leadership.description: This frame concerns the appointment of a New_leader or removal from office of an Old_leader.  The Selector brings about the change in leadership, for example, by electing or overthrowing a leader. Some words in the frame describe the successful removal from office of a leader (e.g. depose, oust), others simply the attempt (e.g. uprising, rebellion).

Dodging.description: A Dodger acts to avoid an oncoming moving Bad_entity.

Fleeing.description: A Self_mover responds to a (real or imagined) danger by moving away from it.

Escaping.description: A Self-moving Escapee departs from an Undesirable_location.

Evading.description: An Evader moves under its own power to thereby avoid Capture  or contact with a Pursuer, also generally moving under its own power. This frame characterizes a  more specific event  than Avoiding in that both the Evader and the Pursuer are moving entities.  In addition, this frame differs from Escaping by requiring a Pursuer and being neutral about the prior captivity of the Evader.

Quitting_a_place.description: A Self_mover leaves an initial Source location.  The Path by which the Self_mover departs, and the Intended_goal of the Direction may also be mentioned.  In many words which evoke this frame, there is an additional implication that the Self_mover is discontented with the Source location.

Means_of_motion.arg_desc: The entity used by the Self_mover in getting away from the undesirable Source.

Goal.arg_desc: Goal is used for any expression which tells where the Self_mover ends up as a result of the motion.

Source.arg_desc: Source is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion.

Escapee.arg_desc: The Escapee manages to leave the Undesirable_location.

Capture.arg_desc: An actual or hypothetical  event in which the Pursuer takes physical control of the Evader.

Pursuer.arg_desc: The Pursuer is going after the Evader unless they act.

Escaping.description: A Self-moving Escapee departs from an Undesirable_location.

Aiming.description: An Agent adjusts an Instrument to enable it to interact directly with a difficult-to-access Target_location.  Usually, there is a Targeted entity at the Target_location which is mentioned in its place.

Instrument.arg_desc: The object manipulated by the Agent in order to interact with the Targeted.

Activity.arg_desc: The Activity is undertaken by the Agent and is directed towards the Targeted or Target_location.

Targeted.arg_desc: The Targeted is the entity located in an indirectly accessible location relative to the Agent.

Agent.arg_desc: The individual that manipulates the Instrument to enable interaction with the Targeted.

Target_location.arg_desc: The location that the Agent wishes to ready the Instrument to access.

Aiming.description: An Agent adjusts an Instrument to enable it to interact directly with a difficult-to-access Target_location.  Usually, there is a Targeted entity at the Target_location which is mentioned in its place.

Hindering.description: In this frame a Hindrance makes it more difficult for a Protagonist to complete their intended Action or a Hindrance directly affects an Action where the Action can be a natural act or the actions of many individuals in a collective endeavor.  Crucially, these lexical units do not entail that the Protagonist was unable to complete the Action or that the Action did not occur. The Hindrance may indicate a lack of enablement or an obstacle on the natural progression of the Protagonist or Action

Action.arg_desc: The Action is what the Protagonist desires to do, which is made more difficult by the Hindrance. It can also be a natural act or collective endeavor, not linked to an overt Protagonist.

Protagonist.arg_desc: The Protagonist is the entity that tends towards or plans some Action which the Hindrance causes to be more difficult.

Hindrance.arg_desc: The Hindrance is the force which makes the Action more difficult or less likely to be successfully completed. The Hindrance may be a lack of enabling force:  The project was hampered by a lack of funds.  or the Hindrance may be an obstacle in the natural progression of the Protagonist or Action.  Burns was hindered by Smither's violent attack.

Hindering.description: In this frame a Hindrance makes it more difficult for a Protagonist to complete their intended Action or a Hindrance directly affects an Action where the Action can be a natural act or the actions of many individuals in a collective endeavor.  Crucially, these lexical units do not entail that the Protagonist was unable to complete the Action or that the Action did not occur. The Hindrance may indicate a lack of enablement or an obstacle on the natural progression of the Protagonist or Action

Preserving.description: In this frame an  Agent preserves a Patient in order to prevent it from decaying.   A Medium may be used.   Bill mummified John.  Tess pickled the beets  in vinegar.  The Smiths dried the apples.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent is the person performing the intentional act that leads to the preservation.Arlene pickled the cucumbers.

Instrument.arg_desc: The Instrument with which an an Agent performs the Preserving.

Means.arg_desc: The Means by which the Agent preserves the Patient.Hannah cured the shrimp by injecting them with brine.This salami was cured naturally in salt.

Patient.arg_desc: The Patient is organic matter that undergoes the preservation.Tess pickled the beets in vinegar.

Preserving.description: In this frame an  Agent preserves a Patient in order to prevent it from decaying.   A Medium may be used.   Bill mummified John.  Tess pickled the beets  in vinegar.  The Smiths dried the apples.

Create_physical_artwork.description: A Creator creates an artifact that is typically an iconic Representation of an actual or imagined entity or event. The Representation may also be evocative of an idea while not based on resemblance.

Craft.description: A  particular Activity, performed conventionally or habitually by more than one Practitioner  within a Culture, is described  in terms of its method.

Means.arg_desc: An action performed by the Creator which brings about the creation of the Representation.

Creator.arg_desc: An individual or individuals that bring the Representation into existence.

Representation.arg_desc: The entity that is created to represent either iconically or abstractly.

Instrument.arg_desc: The entity which the Creator uses to create the work of art.

Activity.arg_desc: This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the  Activity that is being performed habitually or conventionally.

Culture.arg_desc: A Culture within which the Activity is performed.

Create_artwork.description: A Creator creates an artifact that is typically an iconic Representation of an actual or imagined entity or event. The Representation may also be evocative of an idea while not based on resemblance.

Openness.description: A Useful_location is accessible to some (possibly generic) Theme despite a potential Barrier, or is not accessible because of the Barrier.

Useful_location.arg_desc: The place or thing that the Theme is headed towards, despite a potential or actual Barrier.

Theme.arg_desc: The Theme whose motion is blocked or free.

Barrier.arg_desc: An entity that (at least potentially) prevents the Theme from getting to the Useful_location.

Openness.description: A Useful_location is accessible to some (possibly generic) Theme despite a potential Barrier, or is not accessible because of the Barrier.

Spatial_contact.description: A Figure is located in contact with a Ground.  With some words that evoke this frame, the Figure is also asserted to be fully or partially supported by the Ground (e.g. on), while in others a support relation is either denied (e.g. to, as in "she put her hand to the wall") or unspecified (e.g. against).  In addition, some LUs assert a direction in which to find the Figure from the Ground (e.g. atop).

Attaching.description: The Attaching frame covers two situations: a scene in

Figures.arg_desc: The Figures are items which mutually serve to identify the location of each other.

Ground.arg_desc: The Ground serves as a basis for describing the location of the Figure.

Goal.arg_desc: Goal identifies the location to which an Item is attached.

Items.arg_desc: This FE identifies the plural Items that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment.

Handle.arg_desc: Thie Handle is the point of attachment on the Item to which the Agent attaches.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent manipulates an object. Agent typically refers to animate beings, but is also extended to mechanical and other inanimate objects.  It is most frequently expressed as the external argument of verbs. The robber tied Harry to the chair.

Connect.description: A Figure is located in contact with a Ground.  With some words that evoke this frame, the Figure is also asserted to be fully or partially supported by the Ground (e.g. on), while in others a support relation is either denied (e.g. to, as in "she put her hand to the wall") or unspecified (e.g. against).  In addition, some LUs assert a direction in which to find the Figure from the Ground (e.g. atop).

Reveal_secret.description: A Speaker reveals Information that was previously secret to an Addressee. In some cases, the Addressee is expected to keep the Information from other parties. The Information may be damaging to the reputation of the Speaker. Instead of (or in addition to) a Speaker, a Medium may also be mentioned. Likewise, a Topic may be stated instead of Information. Some lexical units in this frame imply that the Addressee has already been confronted with the Information.

Information.arg_desc: Information identifies the content that the Speaker reveals to the Addressee.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.

Addressee.arg_desc: The Addressee is the person to whom the Information is revealed.

Speaker.arg_desc: The Speaker is the sentient entity that reveals  the Information (whether spoken or written).

Topic.arg_desc: The Topic is the subject matter about which the Speaker is speaking. It normally only appears with noun targets, or in special constructions.

Reveal_secret.description: A Speaker reveals Information that was previously secret to an Addressee. In some cases, the Addressee is expected to keep the Information from other parties. The Information may be damaging to the reputation of the Speaker. Instead of (or in addition to) a Speaker, a Medium may also be mentioned. Likewise, a Topic may be stated instead of Information. Some lexical units in this frame imply that the Addressee has already been confronted with the Information.

Response.description: An Agent performs a Response action in consequence of a Trigger event. In many cases, a non-agentive Responding_entity causes the Response after the Trigger occurs.

Respond_to_proposal.description: A Speaker addresses a Proposal made by an Interlocutor, either agreeing to it or rejecting it. Agreeing entails a social responsibility on the Speaker to bring about some state of affairs encoded in the Proposal.

Response_scenario.description: A Trigger elicits a Response by some Responding_entity or an Agent.

Agent.arg_desc: The intentional Agent that is impinged upon by a Trigger event to which they respond.

Responding_entity.arg_desc: A non-agentive entity that is impinged upon by a Trigger event to which they respond.

Response.arg_desc: The means action whereby the Agent responds to the Trigger.

Trigger.arg_desc: An event that impinges upon the Agent or Responding_entity and produces a Response from it.

Interlocutor.arg_desc: This is the person who made the Proposal to the Speaker and to whom the Speaker communicates  their response. This frame element stands in for the Proposal and is only licensed when the Proposal  can be understood from the context.

Response.description: An Agent performs a Response action in consequence of a Trigger event. In many cases, a non-agentive Responding_entity causes the Response after the Trigger occurs.

Court_examination.description: A Questioner asks a Witness (or defendant) questions in the context of a court procedure.

Questioner.arg_desc: The individual who asks a Witness questions.

Witness.arg_desc: A person who is present in a courtroom in order to give some form of evidence, has been sworn in, and is being examined by a Questioner.

Court_examination.description: A Questioner asks a Witness (or defendant) questions in the context of a court procedure.

Scrutiny.description: This frame concerns a Cognizer (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the Ground, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics.  The Cognizer may be interested in a particular characteristic or entity, the Phenomenon, that belongs to the Ground or is contained in the Ground (or to ensure that such a property of entity is not present).

Inspecting.description: An Inspector directs his/her perceptual attention to a Ground to ascertain whether the Ground is intact or  whether an Unwanted_entity is present. Alternatively, the desired outcome of the inspection may be presented as a Purpose.

Scrutinizing_for.description: A Cognizer examines a Ground closely, alert to the presence of a Phenomenon.

Cognizer.arg_desc: The Cognizer pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The FE is normally expressed as an External Argument:

Instrument.arg_desc: An entity directed by the Cognizer  that interacts with the Ground to accomplish the scrutiny.

Phenomenon.arg_desc: Phenomenon identifies the property that belongs to an entity or that the entity contains. Typically, it is expressed as a for-PP.

Ground.arg_desc: The Cognizer pays attention to the Ground, so named because it serves as the background or context for the Phenomenon. This FE can be expressed as an NP Object or as a PP Complement.

Unwanted_entity.arg_desc: An entity whose presence would impair the acceptability or usefulness of the Ground.

Scrutiny.description: This frame concerns a Cognizer (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the Ground, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics.  The Cognizer may be interested in a particular characteristic or entity, the Phenomenon, that belongs to the Ground or is contained in the Ground (or to ensure that such a property of entity is not present).

Light_movement.description: An Emitter emits a Beam of light from a Source, along a Path, and/or towards a Goal.  Essentially, this frame denotes the (semi-)fictive motion of the the Beam.

Emitter.arg_desc: This FE identifies the entity at the Source from which the Beam originates.

Source.arg_desc: The Source is the location the Beam occupies initially before its change of location.

Beam.arg_desc: The light that travels from a Source along a Path to a Goal.

Goal.arg_desc: Goal is the location the Beam ends up in.

Lighting.description: An Emitter emits a Beam of light from a Source, along a Path, and/or towards a Goal.  Essentially, this frame denotes the (semi-)fictive motion of the the Beam.

Criminal_investigation.description: This frame describes the process that involves the inquiry and determination by an authority, the Investigator, of the circumstances surrounding an Incident perpetrated by a Suspect.

Incident.arg_desc: The Investigator attempts to determine the exact circumstances surrounding the Incident, which is typically a criminal act (murder, robbery) or the result of such an act (death, loss of money).

Suspect.arg_desc: This FE denotes the Suspect that is investigated by the Investigator.

Investigator.arg_desc: The Investigator is the person or agency that investigates the Suspect of a crime (Incident).

Criminal_investigation.description: This frame describes the process that involves the inquiry and determination by an authority, the Investigator, of the circumstances surrounding an Incident perpetrated by a Suspect.

Hiding_objects.description: An Agent causes a Hidden_object to become perceptually inaccessible to potential perceivers by placing it in a Hiding_place or putting in place an Obstruction that screens the object.

Obstruction.arg_desc: The entity that the Agent uses to block the Hidden_object from being perceptible.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent is the person who causes the Hidden_entity to be not perceptually accessible to potential perceivers.

Hiding_place.arg_desc: The location in which the Hidden_object is placed so as not to be perceptually accessible.

Hidden_object.arg_desc: The Hidden_object is the entity which is blocked from view.

Hiding_objects.description: An Agent causes a Hidden_object to become perceptually inaccessible to potential perceivers by placing it in a Hiding_place or putting in place an Obstruction that screens the object.

Confronting_problem.description: An Agent becomes involved in an Issue which has negative consequences for them. The Agent will normally respond to resolve the Issue.

Difficulty.description: An Experiencer has an easy or difficult time carrying out an Activity. The ease or difficulty associated with the Activity seems to often be associated with a prominent participant. However, we consider this impression to be due to the syntax and pragmatics of the relevant sentence constructions and employ no special FE for such participants. The Degree of ease or difficulty is often specified as well as a set of Circumstances. A Parameter may be mentioned that indicates in which respect the Activity is judged to be easy or difficult.

Activity.arg_desc: This Frame Element marks expressions indicating the Activity that the Experiencer finds difficult or easy. In many cases, the relevant Activity has to be inferred from the context.

Experiencer.arg_desc: This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate which person judges carrying out the Activity to be easy or difficult.

Confronting_problem.description: An Agent becomes involved in an Issue which has negative consequences for them. The Agent will normally respond to resolve the Issue.

Renting.description: A Lessee gains the use of Goods owned by a Lessor by payment to the Lessor.

Lessor.arg_desc: The individual who has permanent ownership of the Goods and allows them to be used by the Lessee temporarily.

Money.arg_desc: Money is the thing given in exchange for tempory use of the Goods.

Lessee.arg_desc: The individual that gains temporary use of the Goods by paying the Lessor

Goods.arg_desc: The FE Goods is an item which is temporarily exchanged for Money in a transaction.

Renting.description: A Lessee gains the use of Goods owned by a Lessor by payment to the Lessor.

Breathing.description: An Agent causes Air to move in a direction, usually specifying either in or out of the body.

Source.arg_desc: Source identifies the starting point of the Air.

Air.arg_desc: Air is the substance that the Agent causes to move.

Instrument.arg_desc: An entity that allows the Agent to breathe, either a natural part (the lungs, say) or a device (like a respirator).

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent's breathing causes the motion of the Air.  Agent is generally the External Argument.

Goal.arg_desc: This FE identifies the point at which the Air ends up as a result of the motion. Lee breathed into Ann's mouth.

Breathing.description: An Agent causes Air to move in a direction, usually specifying either in or out of the body.

Patrolling.description: An individual or group, the Patrol moves through and examines a Ground in order to ensure that it is in a generally Desired_state_of_affairs, particularly that it is safe and contains no dangerous Unwanted_entity. Rather than moving through the Ground, the Patrol may simply move such that all the (relevant portions of) Ground can be observed and checked.

Vehicle.arg_desc: The Patrol may move around in a Vehicle.

Desired_state_of_affairs.arg_desc: The desirable state of affairs which the Patrol hopes to ensure by visiting Ground.

Ground.arg_desc: The area that the Patrol inspects with to ensure its safety.

Patrol.arg_desc: The person (or group) who inspects the Ground to see that it is safe.

Instrument.arg_desc: An entity used by the Patrol to scrutinize the Ground.

Unwanted_entity.arg_desc: An entity whose presence would impair the desirability or safety of the Ground.

Patrolling.description: An individual or group, the Patrol moves through and examines a Ground in order to ensure that it is in a generally Desired_state_of_affairs, particularly that it is safe and contains no dangerous Unwanted_entity. Rather than moving through the Ground, the Patrol may simply move such that all the (relevant portions of) Ground can be observed and checked.

Arrest.description: Authorities charge a Suspect, who is under suspicion of having committed a crime (the Charges), and take him/her into custody.The police arrested Harry on charges of manslaughter.

Detaining.description: The Authorities hold a Suspect under suspicion of having committed a crime (Charges). The Holding_location and period of detention (Duration) may also be specified. The police held Mr. Smith in the slammer on charges of killing his lawyer.

Imprisonment.description: The Authorities put a Prisoner in Prison as punishment for an Offense.

Being_incarcerated.description: A Prisoner is punished for committing a Crime by being confined to a Prison for a specified period of time.

Being_in_captivity.description: A Theme is held in captivity by an Agent or Cause.

Authorities.arg_desc: The Authorities charge the Suspect with commiting a crime, and take him/her into custody.The police arrested Harry on charges of manslaughter.

Charges.arg_desc: Charges identifies a category within the legal system; it is the crime with which the Suspect is charged.The police arrested Harry on charges of manslaughter.

Suspect.arg_desc: The Suspect is taken into custody, under suspicion of having committed a crime.The police arrested Harry on charges of manslaughter.

Offense.arg_desc: Offense identifies the ordinary language use of the reason for which a Suspect is arrested.

Legal_basis.arg_desc: This FE identifies the law, act, or precedent that allows the Authorities

Prison.arg_desc: The Prison  within which the Prisoner comes to be confined.

Arrest.description: Authorities charge a Suspect, who is under suspicion of having committed a crime (the Charges), and take him/her into custody.The police arrested Harry on charges of manslaughter.

Suasion.description: A Speaker succeeds in getting an Addressee to believe or plan to execute the Content the Speaker has in mind. In most cases, the information is related to some course of action for the Addressee, and the words of this frame imply that the Addressee has formed an intention to act consistently with the Content. There is no implication that the Addressee actually acts upon the intention formed. In the case of convince and persuade, the act that the Speaker wishes the Addressee to perform can be the adoption of a belief, which may be expressed as a that-clause or as an of-PP complement.

Attempt_suasion.description: The  Speaker expresses through language his wish to get the Addressee to act in some way that will help to bring about events or states described in the Content. There is no implication that the Addressee forms an intention to act, let alone acts.

Content.arg_desc: The wish for action on the Addressee's part that the Speaker expresses.

Addressee.arg_desc: The person that the Speaker seeks to influence to act.

Topic.arg_desc: The general item or items that are the focus of the Content of the Speaker's message.

Speaker.arg_desc: The person who intends through the use of language to get another person to act.

Convincing.description: A Speaker succeeds in getting an Addressee to believe or plan to execute the Content the Speaker has in mind. In most cases, the information is related to some course of action for the Addressee, and the words of this frame imply that the Addressee has formed an intention to act consistently with the Content. There is no implication that the Addressee actually acts upon the intention formed. In the case of convince and persuade, the act that the Speaker wishes the Addressee to perform can be the adoption of a belief, which may be expressed as a that-clause or as an of-PP complement.

Commerce_sell.description: These are words describing basic commercial transactions involving a buyer and a seller exchanging money and goods, taking the perspective of the seller.  The words vary individually in the patterns of frame element realization they allow. For example, the typical patterns for SELL: SELLER sells GOODS to BUYER for MONEY.

Means.arg_desc: The Means by which a commercial transaction occurs.

Buyer.arg_desc: The Buyer has the Money and wants the Goods.

Money.arg_desc: Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction.

Goods.arg_desc: The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction.

Seller.arg_desc: The Seller has possession of the Goods and exchanges them for Money from a Buyer.

Commerce_sell.description: These are words describing basic commercial transactions involving a buyer and a seller exchanging money and goods, taking the perspective of the seller.  The words vary individually in the patterns of frame element realization they allow. For example, the typical patterns for SELL: SELLER sells GOODS to BUYER for MONEY.

Cure.description: This frame deals with a Healer treating and curing an Affliction (the injuries, disease, or pain) of the Patient, sometimes also mentioning the use of a particular Treatment or Medication. This frame differs from Medical_intervention in that this frame deals only with cases in which the Patient is cured of the Affliction, not just treated for the Affliction.

Body_part.arg_desc: The Body_part is the specific area of the Patient's body which is treated.

Medication.arg_desc: The injested, applied, injected, etc. substance designed to cure the Patient.

Affliction.arg_desc: The Frame Element Affliction is generally the NP Object of a verb, frequently incorporating the Patient as a possessor, as described above:

Healer.arg_desc: The  Healer, anyone who treats or cures the Patient, occurs as the External Argument of verbs: Doctors alleviated his suffering.

Patient.arg_desc: This   is the sufferer of the injury, disease or pain and can occur as an NP Object in this frame. However, Patient may not be expressed as a separate Frame Element but frequently occurs as the possessor of the Affliction, an example of  FE Conflation:  (See section on Conflation.)

Treatment.arg_desc: The FE Treatment is used for treatments and means, distinguished by separate FEs in FN-1.

Cure.description: This frame deals with a Healer treating and curing an Affliction (the injuries, disease, or pain) of the Patient, sometimes also mentioning the use of a particular Treatment or Medication. This frame differs from Medical_intervention in that this frame deals only with cases in which the Patient is cured of the Affliction, not just treated for the Affliction.

Temporary_stay.description: A Guest stays for a time at a Location, which is not his or her permanent residence, for some Duration. The Location is often the permanent residence of a Host.

Location.arg_desc: The Location where the Guest spends a short amount of time.

Host.arg_desc: The Host is living at the Location on a permanent basis, and is allowing the Guest to stay there.

Guest.arg_desc: The Guest remains for a relatively short period of time in the Location.

Temporary_stay.description: A Guest stays for a time at a Location, which is not his or her permanent residence, for some Duration. The Location is often the permanent residence of a Host.

Dispersal.description: An Agent or a Cause disperses or scatters Individuals from the Source,a relatively confined space, to a the Goal_area, a broader space.

Goal_area.arg_desc: Goal_area identifies the broader space to which the Agent scatters the Individuals

Cause.arg_desc: An event or force that causes that Individuals to disperse.

Individuals.arg_desc: The Individuals are scattered by the Agent.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent disperses or scatters the Individuals.

Source.arg_desc: Source is the relatively confined space from which an Agent scatters the Individuals.

Dispersal.description: An Agent or a Cause disperses or scatters Individuals from the Source,a relatively confined space, to a the Goal_area, a broader space.

Collaboration.description: Partner_1 and Partner_2 or a group of Partners  work together in some Undertaking. The Partners are taken to be of equal status even when expressed disjointly.

Partners.arg_desc: This frame element marks expressions that express the parties that work together in an Undertaking.

Undertaking.arg_desc: This frame element marks constituents that express the project in which the Partners are collaborating.

Collaboration.description: Partner_1 and Partner_2 or a group of Partners  work together in some Undertaking. The Partners are taken to be of equal status even when expressed disjointly.

Extradition.description: A Suspect in a Current_jurisdiction is forced by Authorities (of the Current_jurisdiction) to go to the Crime_jurisdiction, i.e. the jurisdiction which requested that the Suspect be handed over for trial for a crime which he or she is suspected to have committed in the Crime_jurisdiction.  The purpose or reason for the extradition may also be expressed.

Authorities.arg_desc: The Authorities act on behalf of the Current_jurisdiction, giving up the Suspect to the Crime_jurisdiction.

Legal_basis.arg_desc: This FE indicates the basis in law of an extradition.

Crime_jurisdiction.arg_desc: The jurisdiction (generally a nation) to which the Suspect is sent.

Current_jurisdiction.arg_desc: The jurisdiction (generally a nation) the Suspect starts off in.

Suspect.arg_desc: The Suspect is forced to go to the jurisdiction where a crime he or she is suspected of took place or is being tried.

Extradition.description: A Suspect in a Current_jurisdiction is forced by Authorities (of the Current_jurisdiction) to go to the Crime_jurisdiction, i.e. the jurisdiction which requested that the Suspect be handed over for trial for a crime which he or she is suspected to have committed in the Crime_jurisdiction.  The purpose or reason for the extradition may also be expressed.

Cause_to_experience.description: An Agent intentionally seeks to bring about an internal mental or emotional state in the Experiencer.  This frame in closely related to  Experiencer_obj.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent is an External Argument of the target word and purposefully arouses an emotional state.

Instrument.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Instrument with which the Agent brings about the emotional state.

Experiencer.arg_desc: The Experiencer is the person the Agent causes to have a particular emotional state.

Resulting_action.arg_desc: What the Agent intends to make the Experiencer do by causing a certain experience and the Experiencer actually does.

Change_sentiment.description: An Agent intentionally seeks to bring about an internal mental or emotional state in the Experiencer.  This frame in closely related to  Experiencer_obj.

Commitment.description: A Speaker makes a commitment to an Addressee to carry out some future action.  This may be an action desirable (as with promise) or not desirable (as with threaten) to the Addressee. Some of the words in this frame allow an Addressee to be expressed.

Addressee.arg_desc: The Speaker's commitment can be made to an Addressee.  With those words which allow this frame element to be expressed, Addressee usually occurs as a PP Complement headed by to or the (Indirect) Object of verbs: Kim made a promise to me. Kim promised me that everything would be okay.

Speaker.arg_desc: The Speaker is the person who commits him/herself to do something.  Speaker is usually the External Argument of predicative uses of the target or the Genitive modifier of a noun: Jo made a promise to me. Jo promised me she would cook dinner. Jo's promise to cook dinner came to nothing.

Message.arg_desc: An expression of the commitment made by the Speaker expresses the frame element Message.  Message is expressed as a finite or non-finite clausal Complement or an NP Object: I swore that I would never make the same mistake again. The owner finally consented to sell the business. They threatened revenge.

Commitment.description: A Speaker makes a commitment to an Addressee to carry out some future action.  This may be an action desirable (as with promise) or not desirable (as with threaten) to the Addressee. Some of the words in this frame allow an Addressee to be expressed.
