Commerce_pay.description: This frame involves Buyers paying Money for Goods.  In this frame the Money is the direct object, and is mapped to the theme of the transfer.

Seller.arg_desc: The Seller has the Goods and wants the Money.

Money.arg_desc: Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction.

Rate.arg_desc: In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods.

Buyer.arg_desc: The Buyer has the Money and wants the Goods.

Goods.arg_desc: The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction.

Commerce_pay.description: This frame involves Buyers paying Money for Goods.  In this frame the Money is the direct object, and is mapped to the theme of the transfer.

Filling.description: These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme. The area or container can appear as the direct object with all these verbs, and is designated Goal because it is the goal of motion of the Theme. Corresponding to its nuclear argument status, it is also affected in some crucial way, unlike goals in other frames.

Container_focused_placing.description: An Agent or Cause affects a Goal location by moving a Theme, but without necessarily filling or covering it.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent is the actor who instigates the filling.

Cause.arg_desc: An event which brings about the filling of the Goal.

Theme.arg_desc: The Theme is the physical object or substance which changes location. Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls with butter.

Goal.arg_desc: The Goal is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame.

Filling.description: These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme. The area or container can appear as the direct object with all these verbs, and is designated Goal because it is the goal of motion of the Theme. Corresponding to its nuclear argument status, it is also affected in some crucial way, unlike goals in other frames.

Becoming.description: An Entity ends up with some Final_quality--a new fact about the Entity. Alternatively, based on a cluster of changes of characteristics, the Entitynewly meets the conditions for being a member of a Final_category.

Entity.arg_desc: The Entity which undergoes a change, newly ending up in the Final_category or taking on a new Final_quality.

Final_category.arg_desc: The category that the Entity ends up in after the change.  Typically, this entails taking on a number of new characteristics.

Final_quality.arg_desc: A description of a characteristic of the Entity after the change.

Becoming.description: An Entity ends up with some Final_quality--a new fact about the Entity. Alternatively, based on a cluster of changes of characteristics, the Entitynewly meets the conditions for being a member of a Final_category.

Accomplishment.description: After a period in which the Agent has been working on a Goal, the Agent manages to attain it.  The Goal may be a desired state, or be conceptualized as an event.

Agent.arg_desc: The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional act that fulfills the Goal.

Goal.arg_desc: The state or action that the Agent has wished to participate in.

Means.arg_desc: An intentional action performed by the Agent that lets them accomplish their Goal.

Achieve.description: After a period in which the Agent has been working on a Goal, the Agent manages to attain it.  The Goal may be a desired state, or be conceptualized as an event.

Practice.description: An Agent enacts an Action that is intended to be performed again at one or more later Occasions.  The goal of practicing is to ensure that the action at the later Occasion(s) comes off flawlessly.

Occasion.arg_desc: The later enactment or enactments that the Agent expects to perform. Note that the Agent does not have to have specific Occasions in mind.  For our brother's wedding we had to rehearse the dinner twenty times.

Action.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Action that the Agent performs intentionally in order to prepare for a later Occasion.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent performs the Action in preparation for later performances of the same type.

Practice.description: An Agent enacts an Action that is intended to be performed again at one or more later Occasions.  The goal of practicing is to ensure that the action at the later Occasion(s) comes off flawlessly.

Cause_change_of_strength.description: An Agent causes a Patient to be more strong, often resulting in something that is more secure and safe.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent fortifies the Patient.

Cause.arg_desc: An event which causes the Patient to become stronger.

Means.arg_desc: An act performed by an Agent that enables them to act upon the Patient.

Patient.arg_desc: The Patient is the entity that is being made stronger.

Cause_change_of_strength.description: An Agent causes a Patient to be more strong, often resulting in something that is more secure and safe.

Supply.description: A Supplier gives a Theme to a Recipient to fulfill a need or purpose (Imposed_purpose) of the Recipient.

Imposed_purpose.arg_desc: The Recipient's intended purpose for the Theme.

Theme.arg_desc: The object that is given to the Recipient .

Supplier.arg_desc: The person that begins in possession of the Theme and causes it to be in the possession of the Recipient.  I approve of your having supplied him with a file of soldiers.

Recipient.arg_desc: The entity that ends up in possession of the Theme.

Supply.description: A Supplier gives a Theme to a Recipient to fulfill a need or purpose (Imposed_purpose) of the Recipient.

Cause_to_amalgamate.description: These words refer to an Agent joining Parts to form a Whole.  (The Parts may also be encoded as Part_1 and Part_2.)  There is a symmetrical relationship between the components that undergo the process, and afterwards the Parts are consumed and are no longer distinct entities that are easily discernable or separable in the Whole.

Part_2.arg_desc: This FE identifies the second of two Parts mentioned. It is usually a PP Complement.

Parts.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Parts entities being combined, and is often expressed in a single plural NP, usually the direct object of a verb. Chuck merged the corpora into a database.The directors merged the two companies into a conglomerate.

Whole.arg_desc: This  FE identifies Whole as the entity resulting from combination of Parts.  When overtly expressed, it is usually a PP Complement (often headed by into).Chuck merged the corpora into a database. The directors merged the two companies into a conglomorate.

Part_1.arg_desc: This FE identifies the first of two Parts mentioned. It  is most often the NP-Object of a verb.

Agent.arg_desc: In causative uses of these verbs there is an Agent responsible for amalgamating the Parts. The Agent is generally the External Argument (or the object of a PP-by in passives).The chef combined the ingredients.The ingredients were combined by the chef.

Cause_to_amalgamate.description: These words refer to an Agent joining Parts to form a Whole.  (The Parts may also be encoded as Part_1 and Part_2.)  There is a symmetrical relationship between the components that undergo the process, and afterwards the Parts are consumed and are no longer distinct entities that are easily discernable or separable in the Whole.

Scouring.description: A Searcher looks all over a Ground in order to find a Sought_entity. The Sought_entity is not presupposed to exist. The search activity is not concerned with the state of the Ground, which is the case in the Inspecting frame, but only with the finding of the Sought_entity, which is desirable.

Ground.arg_desc: The location that the Searcher covers in looking for the Sought_entity.

Instrument.arg_desc: An entity manipulated by the Searcher to examine the Ground.

Sought_entity.arg_desc: The entity that the Searcher wants to find.

Searcher.arg_desc: The person who is looking all over the Ground for the Sought_entity.

Means.arg_desc: The action of the Searcher that allows them to search the Ground.

Scouring.description: A Searcher looks all over a Ground in order to find a Sought_entity. The Sought_entity is not presupposed to exist. The search activity is not concerned with the state of the Ground, which is the case in the Inspecting frame, but only with the finding of the Sought_entity, which is desirable.

Violence.description: The words in this frame describe acts (or situations characterized by acts) that cause injury or harm. The acts may involve an Aggressor or Cause injuring a Victim, or Aggressors causing each other harm.

Victim.arg_desc: The Victim is the being or entity that is injured.

Instrument.arg_desc: This FE is any object used to cause the injury.

Aggressors.arg_desc: The Aggressors commit acts of violence upon each other.

Means.arg_desc: An intentional action performed by the Aggressor that results in the committing of a violent act.

Cause.arg_desc: The Cause marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that inflicts harm on the Victim

Violence.description: The words in this frame describe acts (or situations characterized by acts) that cause injury or harm. The acts may involve an Aggressor or Cause injuring a Victim, or Aggressors causing each other harm.

Reforming_a_system.description: Because it no longer functions adequately under the given circumstances, an Agent (or non-Agentive Cause) undertakes steps to change the structural makeup of a complex Entity with interdependent parts, for instance an institution or a system of laws. The Degree of change is typically gradual and partial rather than revolutionary and total. Note that with some LUs the Entity can be unexpressed when it is identical to the Agent.

Agent.arg_desc: The sentient entity that effects a change in the Entity.

Entity.arg_desc: This FE denotes a complex, abstract, human-created entity with interdependent parts which has either deteriorated or is no longer adequate for its purpose given a change in circumstances and which the Agent therefore wants to modify.

Initial_category.arg_desc: The category of which the Entity is a member before the Agent causes a change in its makeup.

Cause.arg_desc: This FE is for non-human causes, such as a processes or institutions, responsible for reform.

Means.arg_desc: This FE identifies the steps or actions directly enabling reform.

Final_category.arg_desc: The category that the Entity belongs to after it has undergone the change.

Reforming_a_system.description: Because it no longer functions adequately under the given circumstances, an Agent (or non-Agentive Cause) undertakes steps to change the structural makeup of a complex Entity with interdependent parts, for instance an institution or a system of laws. The Degree of change is typically gradual and partial rather than revolutionary and total. Note that with some LUs the Entity can be unexpressed when it is identical to the Agent.

Gathering_up.description: This frame describes an Agent's gathering of Individuals (people or entities) into a group, the  Aggregate, defined by relative proximity.

Come_together.description: In this frame a group of Individuals meet to form a Configuration. The Individuals or the Configuration may be expressed as the external argument of the predicates in this frame. In this frame, it is ambiguous whether or not the Individuals intentionally come together.  In an alternative construal, a grammatically more prominent Party_1 congregates with a Party_2, expressed as an oblique phrase. If this asymmetric construal is chosen, Purpose relates only to Party_1.

Place.arg_desc: This FE identifies the place where the gathering event occurs.

Individuals.arg_desc: This FE identifies the entities that come together to form an Aggregate.

Agent.arg_desc: Agent is the person who gathers Individuals.

Configuration.arg_desc: The Configuration describes the resulting formation of the individuals.

Come_together.description: In this frame a group of Individuals meet to form a Configuration. The Individuals or the Configuration may be expressed as the external argument of the predicates in this frame. In this frame, it is ambiguous whether or not the Individuals intentionally come together.  In an alternative construal, a grammatically more prominent Party_1 congregates with a Party_2, expressed as an oblique phrase. If this asymmetric construal is chosen, Purpose relates only to Party_1.

Dressing.description: A Wearer puts on an item of Clothing, which then occupies the Body_location.

Clothing.description: This frame refers to clothing and its characteristics,  including anything that people conventionally wear.  The Wearer wears a Garment that has a certain Style, is made of a certain Material, and can be otherwise characterized by a Descriptor.  In some cases, the Body_location (where the garment is worn) and Subregion of the clothing may also be specified.

Wearing.description: The words in this frame refer to what Clothing the Wearer (or a specific Body_part of the Wearer) has on.

Clothing.arg_desc: Clothing is used for the item of clothing that the Wearer ends up wearing.

Body_location.arg_desc: The body part that the Clothing ends up covering.

Wearer.arg_desc: The individual that puts Clothing on their body.

Wearing.description: The words in this frame refer to what Clothing the Wearer (or a specific Body_part of the Wearer) has on.

Cause_to_make_progress.description: An Agent works on a Project so that it reaches a more advanced and desirable state.

Post_state.arg_desc: The state of the Project following an advance.

Prior_state.arg_desc: The former state of the Project.

Agent.arg_desc: The individual that brings about the development of the Project.

Project.arg_desc: The object or idea that undergoes change due to the efforts of the Agent.

Cause_to_make_progress.description: An Agent works on a Project so that it reaches a more advanced and desirable state.

Legality.description: Words in this frame describe the status of an Action with respect to a Code of laws or rules. An Object may also be in violation or compliance of the Code by virtue of its existence, location or possession.

Action.arg_desc: The Action is the behavior which complies with or violates the Code. Illegal drug use is on the rise.

Object.arg_desc: The Object complies with or violates the Code by virtue of its existence, location or possession.

Code.arg_desc: The Code is the set of rules, laws or regulations that determine whether the Action is allowed or prohibited.

Legality.description: Words in this frame describe the status of an Action with respect to a Code of laws or rules. An Object may also be in violation or compliance of the Code by virtue of its existence, location or possession.

Being_employed.description: An Employee has a Position doing work in a particular Field, or doing work on a particular Task, for which an Employer gives Compensation to the Employee.

Rank.arg_desc: Rank is the position in a hierarchy that an Employee occupies within the organization of the Employer.

Employee.arg_desc: The Employee is obligated to perform a Task in order to receive Compensation.

Compensation.arg_desc: The Compensation is the payment that the Employee receives for performing a Task.

Employer.arg_desc: The Employer gives Compensation to an Employee.

Type.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Type of the profession.

Place_of_employment.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Place_of_employment of the Employee.

Contract_basis.arg_desc: The Contract_basis describes the conditions of employment with respect to permanency, hours per time period, or payment basis.

Field.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Field in which one works.

Task.arg_desc: The Employee is obligated to perform the Task to recieve Compensation from the Employer .  My dad works building houses.

Position.arg_desc: The label given to a particular type of employment.

Employment.description: An Employee has a Position doing work in a particular Field, or doing work on a particular Task, for which an Employer gives Compensation to the Employee.

Rite.description: This frame concerns rituals performed in line with religious beliefs or tradition.

Type.arg_desc: The type of ritual or ceremony being performed.

Organization.arg_desc: Organization identifies the institution in which the rite is prescribed.

Object.arg_desc: This FE indicates an object on which a rite is performed.

Instrument.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Instrument used to perform a particular rite.

Member.arg_desc: The FE Member describes the member of the religious or cultural group who participates in/undergoes the rite.

Means.arg_desc: The action that is taken to perform the ritual.

Rite.description: This frame concerns rituals performed in line with religious beliefs or tradition.

Publishing.description: A Publisher makes a Work of an Author (or authors) available to some public Audience for general enjoyment, examination, and reference. The Medium of a Work can vary; examples include books, TV programs, movies, and radio shows. Publication normally involves a number of other events, such as editing and advertising of the Work, and mass production and sales of a represenation of the Work; thus in the most elaborated version of publication, there are a number of other potential roles, such as editor, publicist/advertizer, distributor, printer, etc., but none of these show up as separate, syntactically distinguished roles for the LUs in this frame.

Audience.arg_desc: The subset of the population that the Work is targeted towards or released to.

Author.arg_desc: The person or entity that is responsible for the detailed construction of the content of the Work.  It is normally expressed in place of the Publisher FE, but the Publisher may cooccur with Author, appearing as an adjunct.

Publisher.arg_desc: The entity that acts on behalf of the Author to release the Work to the public.

Medium.arg_desc: The format utilized by the Author to create the Work.

Work.arg_desc: The creation of the Author that is made public by the Publisher.

Publishing.description: A Publisher makes a Work of an Author (or authors) available to some public Audience for general enjoyment, examination, and reference. The Medium of a Work can vary; examples include books, TV programs, movies, and radio shows. Publication normally involves a number of other events, such as editing and advertising of the Work, and mass production and sales of a represenation of the Work; thus in the most elaborated version of publication, there are a number of other potential roles, such as editor, publicist/advertizer, distributor, printer, etc., but none of these show up as separate, syntactically distinguished roles for the LUs in this frame.

Adducing.description: A Speaker mentions a Specified_entity filling a Role, thereby providing information which supports a point of the Speaker.

Speaker.arg_desc: The Speaker is the person who specifies the Role to be filled by the Specified_entity.

Specified_entity.arg_desc: The entity that the Speaker identifies as filling a particular Role.

Role.arg_desc: A slot in a particular or generic event or relation whose filler the Speaker identifies.

Medium.arg_desc: Medium is the physical entity or channel used by the Speaker to transmit the statement.

Addressee.arg_desc: The Addressee is the person to whom the Speaker identifies the filler of a Role.

Adducing.description: A Speaker mentions a Specified_entity filling a Role, thereby providing information which supports a point of the Speaker.

Exchange.description: Two parties, the Exchangers, each give and receive from the other Themes. The parties are also construable separately as Exchanger_1 and Exchanger_2,  in which case the Themes may be construed separately, too, as Theme_1 and Theme_2.

Theme_1.arg_desc: The item that begins in the possession of Exchanger_1.

Theme_2.arg_desc: The item that begins in the possession of Exchanger_2.

Exchanger_2.arg_desc: In cases where the Exchangers involved in a conversation are

Exchanger_1.arg_desc: In cases where the Exchangers involved in a conversation are

Themes.arg_desc: The items which change possession between the Exchangers.

Exchangers.arg_desc: In some sentences both participants are expressed by the Subject, and there is no 'with'-phrase (cf example 1). In sentences like this, the Subject is assigned the FE role Exchangers. In such sentences, the Subject always denotes more than one person, and it is understood that the reciprocal communication takes place between these two (or more) people. The Subject may denote two or more people either through conjunction, as in example 1, or through plurality, as in example 2, or by denoting a group, as in example 3. In each of these cases the FE Exchangers is assigned. Notice that for nouns in the Exchange frame, it is possible for the Exchangers role to be expressed by a prepositional phrase as in example 4.

Exchange.description: Two parties, the Exchangers, each give and receive from the other Themes. The parties are also construable separately as Exchanger_1 and Exchanger_2,  in which case the Themes may be construed separately, too, as Theme_1 and Theme_2.

Exchange_currency.description: A Money_owner exchanges Sum_1 in the  Source_currency for Sum_2 in the Target_currency at some Exchange_service.

Exchange_service.arg_desc: The individual or institution which changes the Money_owner's money into the Target_currency.

Sum_2.arg_desc: The amount of money in the Target_currency that the Money_owner receives in exchange for Sum_1.

Sum_1.arg_desc: An amount of money in the Source_currency that the Money_owner exchanges for an amount in the Target_currency.

Money.arg_desc: Currency that is being exchanged by the Money_owner.

Money_owner.arg_desc: The person who exchanges Sum_1 for Sum_2.

Source_currency.arg_desc: The kind of currency of the Money_owner has before the exchange.

Target_currency.arg_desc: The kind of currency that the Money_owner receives as part of the exchange.

Exchange_currency.description: A Money_owner exchanges Sum_1 in the  Source_currency for Sum_2 in the Target_currency at some Exchange_service.

Ratification.description: A Ratifier responds to a Proposal constructed by another party to make it binding over the Ratifier's jurisdiction or constituency.

Proposal.arg_desc: The idea or course of action proposed by another individual or body which the Ratifier endorses and makes binding.

Ratifier.arg_desc: The individual or body that confirms a Proposal negotiated or created by another party, causing it to become binding in a jurisdiction represented by the Ratifier.  In the case of direct democratic ratification, the jurisdiction and the Ratifier are the same.

Ratification.description: A Ratifier responds to a Proposal constructed by another party to make it binding over the Ratifier's jurisdiction or constituency.

Sign_agreement.description: A Signatory signs an Agreement document, thereby taking on a commitment encoded in the Agreement.

Beneficiary.arg_desc: his extrathematic FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of Agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary.

Instrument.arg_desc: An entity directed by the Signatory that interacts with the Agreement document so as to produce the Signature.

Agreement.arg_desc: The document which encodes the commitment of the Signatory.

Signature.arg_desc: The entity signifying the identity of the Signatory, resulting from the act of writing on the Agreement document.

Sign_agreement.description: A Signatory signs an Agreement document, thereby taking on a commitment encoded in the Agreement.

Shopping.description: A Shopper looks for Goods in order to purchase them.

Commerce_buy.description: These are words describing a basic commercial transaction involving a Buyer and a Seller exchanging Money and Goods, taking the perspective of the Buyer.  The words vary individually in the patterns of frame element realization they allow.  For example, the typical pattern for the verb BUY:

Buyer.arg_desc: The Buyer wants the Goods and offers Money to a Seller in exchange for them.

Goods.arg_desc: The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction.

Money.arg_desc: Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction.

Recipient.arg_desc: The individual intended by the Buyer to receive the Goods.

Seller.arg_desc: The Seller has possession of the Goods and exchanges them for Money from a Buyer.

Commerce_buy.description: These are words describing a basic commercial transaction involving a Buyer and a Seller exchanging Money and Goods, taking the perspective of the Buyer.  The words vary individually in the patterns of frame element realization they allow.  For example, the typical pattern for the verb BUY:

Imposing_obligation.description: A Duty is imposed on a Responsible_party according to a Principle which regulates how the Responsible_party should respond to a Situation.  The Situation may be expressed metonymically by reference to an Obligator, whose action invokes the Principle.  It is only rarely the case that the Principle and the Situation/Obligator are both expressed overtly.

Duty.arg_desc: The action that the Responsible_party is obligated to perform.

Responsible_party.arg_desc: The person who must perform the Duty.

Situation.arg_desc: A state of affairs that results in the Responsible_party being obligated to carry out the Duty in accordance with the Principle.

Principle.arg_desc: A regulating idea  (which may be instantiated as a document)  that the Responsible_party is subject to.

Obligator.arg_desc: The Obligator is the person who imposes the Duty on the Responsible_party.

Imposing_obligation.description: A Duty is imposed on a Responsible_party according to a Principle which regulates how the Responsible_party should respond to a Situation.  The Situation may be expressed metonymically by reference to an Obligator, whose action invokes the Principle.  It is only rarely the case that the Principle and the Situation/Obligator are both expressed overtly.

Fining.description: The Payer is (legally) forced to pay a Fine by an official Speaker as a punishment for some action (the Reason).  The Speaker represents an entity which receives the payment.

Execution.description: An Executioner punishes an individual (Executed) with death as a consequence of some action of the Evaluee (the Reason).

Rewards_and_punishments.description: An Agent (the punisher or rewarder) performs a Response_action on an Evaluee for a Reason, the Evaluee's actions or beliefs.   Means and Instrument may also be indicated.

Corporal_punishment.description: Blend of Rewards_and_punishments and Bodily_injury in which the Agent performs some action intended to cause Bodily harm to the Evaluee as a consequence of some action or belief of the Evaluee (the Reason).

Means.arg_desc: The action that is taken that results in punishement/reward.

Reason.arg_desc: Typically, there is a constituent expressing the Reason for the Agent's judgment. It is usually a 'for'-PP, e.g. I punished him for his impudence.

Response_action.arg_desc: The reward or punishment given to the Evaluee by the Agent.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent is the person doing the rewarding or punishing.

Evaluee.arg_desc: Evaluee is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment has made and to whom reward/punishment is dealt. With verbs, the Evaluee is typically expressed as Object.

Instrument.arg_desc: The Instrument with which the reward or punishment is carried out.

Body_part.arg_desc: This FE is the location on the body where the bodily injury takes place.

Rewards_and_punishments.description: An Agent (the punisher or rewarder) performs a Response_action on an Evaluee for a Reason, the Evaluee's actions or beliefs.   Means and Instrument may also be indicated.

Institutionalization.description: A Patient is committed to the care of a medical Facility by a proper Authority. Regardless of whether the Patient agrees or does not agree with their placement in the Facility, the Authority judges that it is in the best interest of the Patient or his environment that the Patient receive treatment in the Facility.

Patient.arg_desc: The person who is committed to a facility with a view towards helping them mentally or physically.

Affliction.arg_desc: The condition exhibited by the Patient, which is deemed to merit institutionalization by the Authority.

Facility.arg_desc: The facility where the Patient is taken for treatment.

Authority.arg_desc: The Authority is the actor carrying out the institutionalization with proper legal authorization, either invested into them in general by the government or granted due to power of attorney over the Patient.

Duration_of_final_state.arg_desc: This FE identifies the length of the time period for which the Authority has placed  the Patient in the Facility.

Institutionalization.description: A Patient is committed to the care of a medical Facility by a proper Authority. Regardless of whether the Patient agrees or does not agree with their placement in the Facility, the Authority judges that it is in the best interest of the Patient or his environment that the Patient receive treatment in the Facility.

Operational_testing.description: A Tester uses a concrete or conceptual Product in order to determine either whether it works or to find out how well or in which manner it works. The Tester may have particular Unwanted_characteristics in mind that they are specifically looking for. The operational test may also be carried out under a particular set of Circumstances that are typically relevant to the functioning of the Product.

Product.arg_desc: The entity that the Tester uses  to ascertain whether it is intact.

Tester.arg_desc: The person who uses  the Product to see if it is intact or to ascertain its characteristics during operation.

Means.arg_desc: This FE is used for a Means action which the Tester   carries out in testing the Product.

Circumstances.arg_desc: The FE Circumstances is used for circumstances that obtain during the test procedure. These are typically relevant to how the Product functions.

Tested_property.arg_desc: A variable of behavior of the Product which is specifically evaluated.

Testing.description: A Tester uses a concrete or conceptual Product in order to determine either whether it works or to find out how well or in which manner it works. The Tester may have particular Unwanted_characteristics in mind that they are specifically looking for. The operational test may also be carried out under a particular set of Circumstances that are typically relevant to the functioning of the Product.

Examination.description: This frame deals with testing or examination of someone's Knowledge or skill in a particular area.  An Examiner conducts an Examination to an Examinee to determine the Examinee's Knowledge and/or determine their Qualification for some privilege; this proceeds either by the Examinee demonstrating a skill or by writing responses to questions.

Means.arg_desc: An act whereby the Examiner assesses the Examinee.

Examiner.arg_desc: One who administers a test of some kind.The teacher tested the students.

Knowledge.arg_desc: The ability, practice, or command of information on which an Examinee is tested.

Examinee.arg_desc: One who undergoes a test of some kind.The students took a test.

Examination.arg_desc: The Examination that somebody takes.The examination tests driving skills.

Qualification.arg_desc: A credential or status that one acquires by passing an Examination.He took the college entrance exam.

Examination.description: This frame deals with testing or examination of someone's Knowledge or skill in a particular area.  An Examiner conducts an Examination to an Examinee to determine the Examinee's Knowledge and/or determine their Qualification for some privilege; this proceeds either by the Examinee demonstrating a skill or by writing responses to questions.

Ingestion.description: An Ingestor consumes food or drink (Ingestibles), which entails putting the Ingestibles in the mouth for delivery to the digestive system.  This may include the use of an Instrument.  Sentences that describe the provision of food to others are NOT included in this frame.

Ingest_substance.description: In this frame an Ingestor takes a Substance into his or her body. The Delivery_device can appear as a direct object.

Source.arg_desc: Place from which the Ingestor takes the Ingestibles

Ingestor.arg_desc: The Ingestor is the person eating or drinking.

Instrument.arg_desc: The Instrument with which an intentional act is performed.

Ingestibles.arg_desc: The Ingestibles are the entities that are being consumed by the Ingestor.

Ingestion.description: An Ingestor consumes food or drink (Ingestibles), which entails putting the Ingestibles in the mouth for delivery to the digestive system.  This may include the use of an Instrument.  Sentences that describe the provision of food to others are NOT included in this frame.

Labeling.description: A Speaker uses as a Label to refer to an Entity. The Label is not a conventional name for the Entity but a description categorizing the Entity and thereby  expressing a judgment.

Entity.arg_desc: The concrete or abstract thing with which the Speaker has associated a particular linguistic sign.

Label.arg_desc: The linguistic sign that the Speaker uses to designate the Entity.

Medium.arg_desc: A text whose author applies a particular Label to an Entity.

Speaker.arg_desc: The Speaker is the person who conventionally uses a linguistic sign to refer to an Entity.

Labeling.description: A Speaker uses as a Label to refer to an Entity. The Label is not a conventional name for the Entity but a description categorizing the Entity and thereby  expressing a judgment.

Kidnapping.description: The words in this frame describe situations in which a Perpetrator carries off and holds the Victim against his or her will by force.

Goal.arg_desc: Goal is the place in which the Victim ends up.

Victim.arg_desc: The Victim is the person who is carried off and held against his/her will.

Source.arg_desc: Source is the initial location of the Victim before it changes location.

Perpetrator.arg_desc: The Perpetrator is the person (or other agent) who carries off and holds the Victim against his or her will.

Means.arg_desc: An act performed by the Perpetrator that helps them accomplish the kidnapping.

Kidnapping.description: The words in this frame describe situations in which a Perpetrator carries off and holds the Victim against his or her will by force.

Submitting_documents.description: A Submittor gives Documents to an Authority so that they can be processed as part of an application, evaluation or other official or bureaucratic process.

Authority.arg_desc: The individual or organization that ends up in possession of the Documents and processes them.

Documents.arg_desc: The artifacts containing content, typically in the form of text and images, that the Submittor gives to the Authority.

Imposed_purpose.arg_desc: The Authority's intended purpose for the Documents.

Submittor.arg_desc: The person that begins in possession of the Documents and gives them over into the possession of the Authority for processing.  The Human Services financial worker cannot decide if you will get food support benefits until you turn in the form and needed verifications.

Submitting_documents.description: A Submittor gives Documents to an Authority so that they can be processed as part of an application, evaluation or other official or bureaucratic process.

Prison.description: This Frame deals with Penal_institutions. They are run by an Operator and may be intended to hold certain kinds of Inmates.  Penal_institutions may have a special Name and their Location may also be indicated.

Inmates.arg_desc: Inmates marks expressions that indicate the group of people a Penal Institution is intended to hold.

Penal_institution.arg_desc: The locale which serves to confine individuals, generally for the purpose of punishment. This FE is incorporated in each LU in this frame.

Operator.arg_desc: The Frame Element Operator marks expressions that indicate which level of government operates the Penal Institution.

Prison.description: This Frame deals with Penal_institutions. They are run by an Operator and may be intended to hold certain kinds of Inmates.  Penal_institutions may have a special Name and their Location may also be indicated.

Justifying.description: An Agent has done or omitted to do an Act or is responsible for the obtaining of a State_of_affairs, which a Judge deems to constitute a violation of an obligation or a moral guideline. The Agent gives a Reason why the Act or omission or State_of_affairs was licit despite appearances.

State_of_affairs.arg_desc: A State_of_affairs that the Agent is held responsible for.

Agent.arg_desc: The person or organization that  is held responsible for a prior Act or for a State_of_affairs.

Explanation.arg_desc: The set of facts or circumstances that the Agent offers in explanation of their earlier Act or of the State_of_affairs

Judge.arg_desc: The person or institution that holds the Agent responsible for an Act or State_of_affairs.

Justifying.description: An Agent has done or omitted to do an Act or is responsible for the obtaining of a State_of_affairs, which a Judge deems to constitute a violation of an obligation or a moral guideline. The Agent gives a Reason why the Act or omission or State_of_affairs was licit despite appearances.

Emergency.description: This frame characterizes the situation or state of affairs in which someone should or must act to prevent a Undesirable_event from occurring. Often, an Entity affected by the Undesirable_event is more salient than the event itself and is mentioned in its place.

Emergency_fire.description: A fire which burns and requires an emergency-type response.

Undesirable_event.arg_desc: The potentially damaging event that should be prevented or ameliorated.

Experiencer.arg_desc: This FE identifies the experiencer within the emergency action chain, often relating the person or group who feels or is threatened by the emergency.

Place.arg_desc: The location where the emergency situation arises.

Duration.arg_desc: How long the Emergency takes place.

Emergency.description: This frame characterizes the situation or state of affairs in which someone should or must act to prevent a Undesirable_event from occurring. Often, an Entity affected by the Undesirable_event is more salient than the event itself and is mentioned in its place.

Terrorism.description: A Terrorist commits a violent or otherwise harmful Act upon a Victim in order to coerce or terrorize a government or populace. The Act may be committed in particular for political or ideological reasons, and is often directed at civilians, as opposed to government or military officials. It is most often in violation of one or many laws.

Instrument.arg_desc: The Instrument is used by the Terrorist in order to inflict harm or commit the Act.

Terrorist.arg_desc: The Terrorist commits the Act of terror for political or ideological gains.

Victim.arg_desc: The Victim is most directly affected or harmed by the Act of terrorism.

Place.arg_desc: The location where the Act takes place.

Act.arg_desc: The Act is the harmful action performed by the Terrorist or terrorist organization.

Means.arg_desc: The intermediate action performed by the Terrorist in order to comit the Act.

Terrorism.description: A Terrorist commits a violent or otherwise harmful Act upon a Victim in order to coerce or terrorize a government or populace. The Act may be committed in particular for political or ideological reasons, and is often directed at civilians, as opposed to government or military officials. It is most often in violation of one or many laws.

Vocalizations.description: This frame is concerned with the sounds produced by animate entities by means of their vocal tracts. Descriptions of sounds from artifacts meant to emulate such sounds, or to act as vocalizing animals or people, are also treated here as figurative language.

Sound_source.arg_desc: An entity that is construed as a single point source emitting sound.

Internal_cause.arg_desc: The noise-making may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an Internal_cause,  that is the mental or emotional state of an animate Sound_source.

Vocalizations.description: This frame is concerned with the sounds produced by animate entities by means of their vocal tracts. Descriptions of sounds from artifacts meant to emulate such sounds, or to act as vocalizing animals or people, are also treated here as figurative language.

Daring.description: An Agent performs some Action which is considered imprudent.  This frame is distinct from Attempt in that the danger that the Agent puts themselves in by performing the Action is profiled.  The danger is not spelled out, but generally the Action has a possibility or likelihood of causing social or physical harm to the Agent.

Action.arg_desc: This FE denotes the Action taken by the Agent.

Agent.arg_desc: The individual that performs the Action, resulting in danger to themself.

Risk.description: An Agent performs some Action which is considered imprudent.  This frame is distinct from Attempt in that the danger that the Agent puts themselves in by performing the Action is profiled.  The danger is not spelled out, but generally the Action has a possibility or likelihood of causing social or physical harm to the Agent.

Resolve_problem.description: An Agent resolves an outstanding Problem by finding its solution, explanation, answer, etc.  Alternatively, some non-agentive Cause may resolve the Problem.  The Means, Degree, Time and Place may also be expressed.

Means.arg_desc: The Means is an intermediate action taken by the Agent in order to resolve the Problem.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent finds the solution or explanation to the outstanding mystery or Problem.

Instrument.arg_desc: The Instrument is an entity used for resolving the Problem .

Problem.arg_desc: The Problem is the predicament or mystery that is resolved.

Beneficiary.arg_desc: This FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the resolution of a Problem .

Cause.arg_desc: The Cause is the non-Agentive event or state of affairs that brings about the resolution of the Problem.

Outcome.arg_desc: The Outcome is the failure or success of resolving a Problem .

Resolve_problem.description: An Agent resolves an outstanding Problem by finding its solution, explanation, answer, etc.  Alternatively, some non-agentive Cause may resolve the Problem.  The Means, Degree, Time and Place may also be expressed.

Revenge.description: This frame concerns the infliction of punishment in return for a wrong suffered. An Avenger performs a Punishment on a Offender as a consequence of an earlier action by the Offender, the Injury. The Avenger inflicting thePunishment need not be the same as the Injured_Party who suffered the Injury,  but the Avenger does have to share the judgment that the Offender's action was wrong. The judgment that the Offender had inflicted an Injury  is made without regard to the law.

Avenger.arg_desc: The Avenger exacts revenge from the Offender for the Injury.

Injury.arg_desc: The Injury is the injurious action committed by the Offender against the Injured_Party. This Frame Element need not always be realized, although it is conceptually necessary.

Punishment.arg_desc: The Avenger carries out a Punishment in order to exact revenge on the Offender.

Instrument.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Instrument with which the revenge is performed.

Offender.arg_desc: The Offender has committed the earlier Injury for which the Avenger seeks revenge.

Injured_party.arg_desc: This frame element identifies the constituent that encodes who or what suffered the Injury at the hands of the Offender. Sometimes, an abstract concept such a person's honour or their blood is presented as the element that has suffered the Injury. These also constitute instances of  Injured_party

Revenge.description: This frame concerns the infliction of punishment in return for a wrong suffered. An Avenger performs a Punishment on a Offender as a consequence of an earlier action by the Offender, the Injury. The Avenger inflicting thePunishment need not be the same as the Injured_Party who suffered the Injury,  but the Avenger does have to share the judgment that the Offender's action was wrong. The judgment that the Offender had inflicted an Injury  is made without regard to the law.

Limiting.description: An Agent or Cause limits a Range_of_options to having a certain Characteristic. The Characteristic may be that only certain types of the Range_of_options may be acceptable, or (in the case of a plural or mass Range_of_options) that only certain cardinalities or quanties are acceptable. Alternatively, the Degree to which the Range_of_options is limited may be mentioned.

Limitation.description: An Entity that would be expected to have a characteristic to a certain degree (typically based on comparison to other entities of the same type) instead has a more limited degree of that characteristic.

Characteristic.arg_desc: The Characteristic indicates the subtypes or situations to which the Range_of_options is limited.

Range_of_options.arg_desc: The Range_of_options would normally be expected to have a set of possibilites, but is limited by an Agent or Cause to particular subtypes, situations or characteristics.

Cause.arg_desc: The Cause is a natural occurrence or state-of-affairs that limits the Range_of_options.

Agent.arg_desc: The Agent consciously places limits upon the Range_of_options.

Means.arg_desc: An act performed by the Agent or Cause that accomplishes the action indicated by the target.

Entity.arg_desc: The Entity would normally be expected to have a set of possibilites, but instead exhibits only certain possibilites, or exhibits them on fewer situations than expected.

Limiting.description: An Agent or Cause limits a Range_of_options to having a certain Characteristic. The Characteristic may be that only certain types of the Range_of_options may be acceptable, or (in the case of a plural or mass Range_of_options) that only certain cardinalities or quanties are acceptable. Alternatively, the Degree to which the Range_of_options is limited may be mentioned.

Experimentation.description: An Experimenter conducts an Experiment based on a Hypothesis.  This Experiment contains a Control_group or Control_group_member which is compared with a Treatment_group or Treated_individual in order to determine the Result.

Research.description: A Researcher (an individual a group or institution) attempts to answer a Question by means of consulting literature,  observation, or conducting experiments in a particular Field pertinent to the Question. The Question may be underspecified in the form of a Topic.

Control_group.arg_desc: The group of entities in the Experiment which have not been treated and are compared to the Treatment_group or Treated_individual.

Subjects.arg_desc: In this frame Control_group and Treatment_group can be combined and expressed as Subjects.  This FE can also be used for a generic individual on whom the Experiment is being conducted (see second example).

Result.arg_desc: The Result depicts the outcome of the Experiment.

Phenomenon.arg_desc: A property that belongs to either the Control_group or the Treatment_group.  Usually expressed by a PP.

Treatment_group.arg_desc: A group of subjects that receive Treatment and are compared to the Control_group or Controlled_individuals.

Instrument.arg_desc: A tool used in conducting the Experiment.  Usually expressed by a with-PP.

Topic.arg_desc: The Topic is the subject that the Experiment is studying.

Hypothesis.arg_desc: The Hypothesis is a conjecture as to the result of an Experiment.  The Experiment takes place in order to prove the Hypothesis as correct or incorrect.

Researcher.arg_desc: The people engaged in a research endeavor.

Means.arg_desc: The experimentations, observations, or other procedures performed by the Researcher in order to find an answer to the Question.

Research.description: A Researcher (an individual a group or institution) attempts to answer a Question by means of consulting literature,  observation, or conducting experiments in a particular Field pertinent to the Question. The Question may be underspecified in the form of a Topic.

Having_or_lacking_access.description: A Theme has access to a Useful_location or is blocked from it by a Barrier.

Barrier.arg_desc: An entity, event, or state that (at least potentially) prevents the Theme from getting to the Useful_location.

Useful_location.arg_desc: The place or thing that the Theme is headed towards, despite a potential or actual Barrier.

Theme.arg_desc: The Theme whose motion is blocked or free.

Having_or_lacking_access.description: A Theme has access to a Useful_location or is blocked from it by a Barrier.

Theft.description: These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator takes Goods from a  Victim or a Source. The Means by which this is accomplished may also be expressed.

Instrument.arg_desc: An object used by the Perpetrator in taking possession of the Goods.

Victim.arg_desc: Victim is the person (or other sentient being or group) that owns the goods before they are taken away by the perpetrator.

Goods.arg_desc: Goods is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be taken away.

Means.arg_desc: This FE identifies the Means by which a Perpetrator takes the Victim's Goods.

Perpetrator.arg_desc: Perpetrator is the person (or other agent) that takes the goods away.

Source.arg_desc: Source is the initial location of the goods, before they change location.

Theft.description: These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator takes Goods from a  Victim or a Source. The Means by which this is accomplished may also be expressed.

Coincidence.description: A State_of_affairs (a state or event) either holds or occurs, and is presented as being causally independent of other (implicit) states or events that might otherwise have been expected to be causally related to the State_of_affairs. The Time or Place may also be mentioned.

Time.arg_desc: The Time at which the State_of_affairs holds.

Place.arg_desc: The Place where the State_of_affairs holds.

State_of_affairs.arg_desc: A State_of_affairs (that is, an event or state) that holds independently of (potentially) causally-related States of affairs.

Incident.description: A State_of_affairs (a state or event) either holds or occurs, and is presented as being causally independent of other (implicit) states or events that might otherwise have been expected to be causally related to the State_of_affairs. The Time or Place may also be mentioned.

Deserving.description: The existence of a State_of_affairs is sufficient reason for taking an Action . The agent who is justified in taking the suggested Action is not part of the immediate scene, however.

State_of_affairs.arg_desc: An Eventuality or an Entity that is taken to constitute sufficient reason for taking another Action.

Action.arg_desc: An Action that is taken to be justifiable given the State_of_Affairs.

Award.description: The existence of a State_of_affairs is sufficient reason for taking an Action . The agent who is justified in taking the suggested Action is not part of the immediate scene, however.
